title: Nouns X Internet Game: Season 2 w/ gmoney
description:
# Nouns X Internet Game: Season 2 w/ gmoney

**Dear NounsDAO,**

I’m a *huge* fans of Nouns. A big part of my Solidity education was forking the Nouns contract back when we were at Noun #3. So I’m super thrilled to present an idea that integrates Nouns into what I've been working on for 2 years, & can contribute to the Nounish goal of spreading the Nouns meme far & wide.

----

**TLDR:** We are Internet Game. We host massive web3 game shows with thousands of players and blue-chip NFT prizes. Our Season 2 is coming up next, hosted by gmoney, and we’d like to re-skin one of the games to feature Nouns, as well as educate our players about Nouns with a video prior to the game.

Before we get into specifics, we’ll share a bit more about who we are and why we’re qualified to propose this…

## What is Internet Game??

[Internet Game](https://internet.game/) is Squid Game meets NFTs. We create live, interactive game shows that anyone can play at home with hyper-simple, yet dangerously fun mini-games. 60% of buy-ins go to blue-chip NFT prizes, all voted on by the community in Discord.

In March 2022 we launched our Internet Game: [Season 1](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1ut4uEdKyydQ3lFZFoGIMUWpsqXQh_ZE3NugP6UGIE-c/edit#slide=id.g13ad4d9e874_0_0). 8000 players minted $2.2M in NFTs to play. We then purchased $1M+ in NFT prizes as voted on by the players, including Bored Apes, Mutant Apes, Doodles, Azukis, CloneX and many more.

The best way to fully understand how our seasons work is to[ look at this case study](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1ut4uEdKyydQ3lFZFoGIMUWpsqXQh_ZE3NugP6UGIE-c/edit#slide=id.p).

Internet Game: Season 2 “Bear Market Battle” launches on September 12th. Season 2 features 6 brand new games taking place between September 12th and 23rd. The entire event is hosted by the infamous gmoney & comedian Leah Lamarr. Gmoney will appear as a full 3D version of his cryptopunk by being rigged up in a high-fidelity motion capture suit, and will then be superimposed on an XR stage (picture a gigantic LED screen & floor) next to Leah.

## Season 2 Trailer:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9lr3GruECkk

Here’s a preview of what that looks like from the podcast we did with gmoney on the XR stage with him in the co-cap suit:

![|624x323](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/R2_yJv7VgaZlSyENj-pB3qwG82IdRuM9S1i94XuvPAeTjmR2gD5Hnqiz-vE7NWVMMAFtEY4ZTSFat4h1jg9DTlxnubOXHtnfWIhRnJIAmcmypoVrmrmuGvGc5RIU2Hw-z3xxbllb31NhvAAY-eXIk8w)

## The Opportunity: Nouns Game + Video in Season 2

Internet Game Season 2 is made up of 6 mini-games that take place over the course of two weeks. Each game runs for 24 hours.

There is an opportunity to fully brand the third game, currently titled as “The Last Spaceship”, and transform it into “The Last Noun”.

The game itself is similar to an old school Asteroids / Galaga space shooter, but with an original take on how you move around the space. We think the 2D arcade aesthetic is a perfect match for the Nouns art. Both the main character as well as the enemies would be Nouns:

## The Opportunity: Nouns Game + Video in Season 2

Internet Game Season 2 is made up of 6 mini-games that take place over the course of two weeks. Each game runs for 24 hours.

There is an opportunity to fully brand the third game, currently titled as “The Last Spaceship”, and transform it into “The Last Noun”.

The game itself is similar to an old school Asteroids / Galaga space shooter, but with an original take on how you move around the space. We think the 2D arcade aesthetic is a perfect match for the Nouns art. Both the main character as well as the enemies would be Nouns:

![|624x351](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ZrfJjzdDNdvppKlA7NnrR3y1Z3n0lawfD0Sn7AjCWhs7IrUZQQS__5u6b7ObNVMdB0B_QrkvRppL_W2Z72iJ7k9xKgRXdUgMYEDaOKDn7x4DqR4FZrrs7Cv2DSmNoUyewBoHn3dFAlss1B8Z0Osyd9I)

After the completion of Season 2, “The Last Noun” will exist on the Internet Game Arcade (launching Q1 2023) and used in future tournaments with other Discords, influencers and NFT communities, bringing consistent exposure to the brand to a variety of audiences.

## The Video

A video is shown before each of the games featuring gmoney & Leah. If desired, we could include a trailer / explainer / hype video for Nouns in that video. This would need to be provided by Nouns DAO.

**Additional opportunities during Season 2:**

* Including Nouns and/or Lil Nouns in our prize pool
* Skinning the entire Internet Game tournament page during “The Last Noun” game to be Nouns-branded
* Upon the launch of the game, post a write up on our social platforms (Twitter/Discord) to educate our audience on Nouns DAO and the Nouns mission & mechanics

## Our Ask:

**ETH Sponsorship:** Nouns DAO would contribute 20 ETH to Internet Game Season 2. The sponsorship would be split to further contribute to the prize pool and cover operational expenditures incurred by Internet Game.

## Proposed Timeline & Next Steps

* Engage in discussions to answer any questions derived from this proposal
* Gain approval to transform “The Last Spaceship” into “The Last Noun”
* Announce partnership with Nouns DAO for Season 2 including the donation to the prize pool
* Complete redesign of the tournament page and game and showcase to Nouns DAO for feedback
* Launch “The Last Noun” Game on September 16th, along with the optional pre-game video

## Long-Term Opportunity: Nouns Custom Casual Game

We we would love to continue the relationship and build a fully custom game for Nouns that can live on in perpetuity. The game would be co-created by the DAO and Internet Game to provide a unique experience that allows consumers to connect with the Nouns brand in an interactive way. Casual gaming is a juggernaut of an industry due to its accessibility (ease of learning), low effort requirement, and repeat value (easy to hop in and out of) it provides. We see a Nouns Game as a way to engage the general population in a highly scalable and interactive way all around the world. Details on this longer-term partnership opportunity can be submitted through a separate proposal.

---

*Thank you for reading! We'll be excitedly watching the voting.*

title: Noun Sounds Proposal
description:
# Noun Sounds Proposal

[![](https://i.imgur.com/AqMhNe3.jpg)](https://vimeo.com/746662212
)

WATCH VIDEO: https://vimeo.com/746662212

## **TL;DR** 

Noun Sounds will provide a much needed audio-scape to the Nouns ecosystem.  SuperTightWoody and Papaya will create a platform and ingest processes where anyone can create, export and contribute CC0 Nounish songs, stems, samples, sounds effects and more.

![](https://i.imgur.com/96a5gtJ.png)

# The Problem

There is currently no Nouns audio aesthetic, and no environment for it to flourish. There are no sonic logos, sounds or songs that have a consistent use case in the Nouns world. Nounish creators of apps, videos, games and beyond have nowhere to turn for audio. 

Nounish creators have to source their own audio, often out of their own pocket while being forced to manage limited use rights.

All of this makes brand consistency/recognition difficult and next to impossible. Sonic logos, sounds or songs are a core part of any brand.  

![](https://i.imgur.com/VN0FNJY.png)


# Our Solution

**nounsounds.wtf**

We will create a robust website that will act as a hub for all things related to Nouns audio. This will include an easy to use music “PLAYground” to build a unique Nouns song for your project, a repository of samples/sounds/songs and a robust roadmap with processes and structure, allowing our environment to grow.

![](https://i.imgur.com/UevPiIZ.png)

---

# The User Experience

## **Homepage**

![](https://i.imgur.com/Z53wdaT.png)

On the homepage, the latest Noun Sound will be displayed along with the Noun it generates!  **This, and all Noun Sounds, will be available for free use and CC0**.

 How does it generate this Noun Sound you might ask?  Let’s head over to the…

## **PLAYground**

![](https://i.imgur.com/pwDMdY5.png)

The visual Noun will be generated via the PLAYground tab.  

In this area, a song is split into its different tracks. Here, one of the 10 songs created for Nouns will be selected.  Each song will contain 5 variations per instrument. Each instrument will correspond to a Nouns layer whose assets will be randomly generated when the page loads. 

Refreshing the page or hitting the “Randomize” button will randomly select a new SONG and new set of LAYERS.  Every time you create a new Nouns Sound, a unique new Noun will be born to accompany it!

Put together your favorite song tracks for your project and…VOILA!  You now have your own unique Noun Sound.

[![](https://i.imgur.com/kAFMtLi.png)
](https://vimeo.com/738442849/e3cdaf3d87)
WATCH VIDEO: https://vimeo.com/738442849/e3cdaf3d87

## **Sounds**

![](https://i.imgur.com/9DU37V1.png)

If you want to grab any of the full songs, stems, loops, samples or sound effects by themselves- this is the place to go.  Easily filter these via metadata and get to creating your Nounish multimedia! 

# How Does This Proliferate Nouns?

***Sound*** is the backbone of any cohesive brand and multimedia creation.  This CC0 resource will assist in the production of music, apps, games, videos, social content, sonic branding and more- all revolving around Nouns.  As we work along side Nouns DAO in the future, a self sustaining library of high quality audio will fill a void for creators across all mediums of creative content. 

# The Team

With 20+ years of music production and engineering experience, **SuperTightWoody** is a Grammy Nominated music producer.  Having works featured on major label albums, TV shows, movie trailers and television commercials.  In the Nouns space, he has created the theme song for the Nouncil along with theme songs for The Noun Square Twitter spaces (and the “soundboard” for TNS).  As a Nouncil and TNS member- he is very much looking forward to expanding his contributions into the Nouns space.

**Papaya** is a software engineer with 15+ years of experience known for his attention to detail. He has worked on numerous NFT Collections, tools and Defi protocols. He loves building unique experiences for web3 communities and developers. 

# Timeline

The creation of everything laid out in this first proposal will take 3 months to complete from proposal approval.

# Proposed Funding

72ETH for deliverables + timeline. 
*Signers will be SuperTightWoody and Papaya for multisig wallet 0xE8cF782Bb4aCB9000fae76bA940295CA988DE7Be*

---

# Deliverables

**This Proposal: First Audio Library + Infrastructure**  

Our first proposal is to create the first Nounish audio library, a website, an easy-to-use tool for builders to create songs, and laying out the workflows for onboarding new music makers into the system processes.

- *A fully functional Noun Sounds website with user friendly audio interfaces*
- *10 CC0 Noun Sounds songs (+ 5 variations of each instrument for the PLAYground)*
- *3 Nouns sonic logo stings*
- *20 bleeps, bloops, swooshes and more for apps and games*
- *All songs, stems and individual samples page available for download*
- *Twitter account and Discord for building the Noun Sounds community*

---

**Next Proposal: New Tools + Bring on other musicians**

Once this infrastructure has been built and our ingestion flow for new audio is set, it’s time to grow independently.

- *Create Noun Sounds DAO*
- *Start developing system to Fund DAO through the sales of generated Noun Sounds NFTs.*
- *Create pipeline for onboarding new musicians via sounds submissions + legal processes*
- *Create professional VST instruments that music makers can use in the DAW of their choice, to create an audio palette that allows total freedom while keeping brand cohesion*
- *Explore the use of AI and other technologies to push the envelope of what is possible*

![](https://i.imgur.com/etJbiGT.png)

## Additional Links:

www.supertight.co

www.soundcloud.com/supertightwoody

www.soundcloud.com/nounspoap

## Proposed Transactions:

1. 0xE8cF782Bb4aCB9000fae76bA940295CA988DE7Be.transfer(
 72 ETH
)

title: Pilot: Crowdsourced Prop House
description:
# Pilot: Crowdsourced Prop House

### tl;dr:

Requesting 40 ETH to pilot using Prop House as a self-curation tool.

### Preliminary Round:

The preliminary round will be used to source ideas for prop house topics from the community. The two submissions with the most votes will each be chosen as the theme of a subsequent 20 ETH prop house round.

The preliminary round will NOT reward the winning submissions, so as to not incentivize spam/duplicates.

### Secondary Round:

The prize distributions for the secondary rounds will be left up to the sole discretion of the Prop House team within the following bounds:

Minimum: 1 x 20 ETH
Maximum: 5 x 4 ETH

It is also left up to the discretion of the Prop House team to decide how to best conduct this experiment, as long as the specifications above are met.

### Safe
Funds will be managed from a 2/3 safe at 0x58a25b8C593C75F6bcEb2C805a53437DA3C53757 managed by seneca, devcarrot and cdt.

title: Nounish Friends - Stage 2
description:
# Nounish Friends - Stage 2

![](https://i.imgur.com/Dcj8zF9.jpg)

___
**I. WHAT IS THIS PROJECT?**
___
Designed for maximum NOUNish-ness, these colorful 3” tall mini figures are meant to be a fun, low cost and non-crypto-based entry point into the world of “NOUNs.” Nounish Friends will be packed into colorful mystery boxes and presented in eye catching counter display cartons which are found in shops worldwide.
Prop 72 funded with 20ETH to take this project from initial idea, through countless iterations, to the current designs & prototypes. We have communicated updates weekly on the [Discord here](https://discord.com/channels/849745721544146955/973957832015761428) and have had many conversations on [Discourse here](https://discourse.nouns.wtf/t/proposal-nounish-friends-nouns-town-collectible-figures-and-more-by-bigshottoyworks/967/42?page=3&fbclid=IwAR2b6AnS2-xKAbn0eja5dL0k1LCufZM4v_nT5NbJXzZ_ZWWb5FEo_PIxly8), gathering feedback from over 50 comments to arrive at the final designs we’re proposing today. 

![](https://i.imgur.com/mJ5emSS.jpg)

___
**II. PROJECT DEVELOPMENT COSTS:**
___
**CURRENT STAGE:**
 - **Engineering:**  tooling masters, paint masks, production molds, Packaging, Final branding, box and display box design and dies: $45K ***(one time cost)***
 - **Manufacturing:** $53K for 10K pcs 
 - **Logistics/warehousing:** $29K
 - **Marketing, project management & B2B & B2C sales:** $40K for 6 months. This involves sample photography,press, targeted social media engagement, onboarding  and follow ups, potential partner onboarding and communications. This includes unexpected sample creations and air shipping for events such as Art Basel, Dcon, NFTNYC and other opportunities world wide while the mass production run is being produced.
 - **TOTAL ASK:** $167K USD

**PAYMENT SCHEDULE:**
Payments to be broken down into 3 milestones as follows: 
 - **35% upfront** ($58,450 USD)
Preproduction deposit for further final development of graphics, packaging templates, tooling molds, paint molds, and final samples.
 - **35% on Milestone 1** ($58,450 USD)
Deposit for mass production deposit once tooling test shots and painted counter sample approvals,
 - **30% on Milestone 2** (50,100 USD)
Full balance paid out once production passes testing. QC inspection and is ready to ship to our warehouse by sea.

**PAYMENT DETAILS**
 - **GNOSIS SAFE**
ETH will be sent to a 2/3 Gnosis Safe with the following signers:
Bigshot Klim - 0xd25912007EBC2527d4ED9DC536f928E550b0f02C
Joshua Fisher - JoshuaFisher.eth
Joel Cares - JoelCares.eth

 - **ETH -> USD CONVERSION**
Calculations done on 9/14/2022 at $1,600 USD / ETH
Project Cost = $167,000 USD = 104.38 ETH
Volatility Buffer (10%) = 10.44 ETH
TOTAL ASK = 114.82 ETH 

 - **PROCEDURE**
   - A 10% buffer was added to the ask to account for volatility in ETH prices prior to conversion.
   - Upon recieving the funds Gnosis Safe operators will immediately convert ETH to USDC to cover total Project Cost. The USDC will be held in the safe and released to Bigshot Klim when Milestones are completed.
   - If for any reason there are excess funds (ETH remaining  after conversion, milestones not hit) any unspent funds will be returned to Nouns DAO.
   - If the value of ETH falls sufficiently before conversion and this value no longer covers project costs another proposal will be submitted to cover the difference. 

 - **TRANSACTION**
transfer 114.82 ETH to 0xA04D191Ae755c442B5e4a0ea10136b7B0354cC6a

___
**III. FUTURE STEPS**
___

Our 10,000 physical toys will be utilized for both sales and giveaways for maximum reach and value. We believe that both are important aspect of this proof of concept model moving forward:

 - 10% -1,000 toys(100 sets) allocated to community members and other Nouns initiatives like Nouns OTG, Rose Bowl and Art Basel Miami etc. Final production Toys will be allocated and shipped from our warehouse (worldwide approx shipping/handling cost $35 per case of toys) 
 - 9,000 units to be sold at SRP $14/toy, or approx $7 wholesale + shipping. Portion of the sales will be used to develop series 2 and put forth in a proposal if the project is a success. 
 - Option for DAO allocated additional quantities from this edition at $7/unit 
 - Option to re-order at lower unit cost ($5-6/unit) in a future run.
 - Option to create unique colorways & revised single-unit packaging at lower unit cost.
 - A collectible card with a POAP is included with each toy. Use TBD, but it will help with future engagement and retain customer attention.Collectors and fans could receive digital goodies, participate in games, contests or win prizes from our NOUNWORKS shop, and/or have access to unique experiences for POAP holders only. Goodies and prizes can be things in our shops or future items from the community based on the promotions and future partnerships and collaborations(TBD) based on Nounish partners and collaborations.

It is imperative that we expedite manufacturing so that we can have product ready for public introduction and review at Designercon in November 18-20 2022 (10X20 Booth booked), Art Basel in Miami in December, and possible availability for distribution at Rose Bowl (Jan 1, 2023) with Stoopid Buddy Studios. We can support global meet ups with products as well as some blank figures for local artists to paint.



All of the items ship from a central location in USA so the marketing and proliferation logistics are perfectly aligned. These steps, including ongoing press and social media support, are crucial to any project of this scope and everything has a price. Since we have multiple ongoing projects with NOUNs and plan many more, we want to be as efficient as possible with our time as well as resources.
We are excited to create and distribute the very best  Nouns toys! We have built out a model that is scalable for large-scale runs in the future after this concept is proven.

title: Nounifying Brazil and Web3 Workshops in communities of Rio de Janeiro
description:
"# Nounifying Brazil and Web3 Workshops in communities of Rio de Janeiro

*This proposal submission was executed by [Gnars DAO](https://gnars.com).*

Nounify the skate lane in the Gigoia Island community and onboard 120 teenagers – from 11 to 14 years old – to web3 at the *[Skate Cuida Institute](https://www.instagram.com/skatecuida/?hl=pt)* - both in Rio de Janeiro.

**Why?**

According to [Statista](https://www.statista.com/), **Brazil is the 2nd country with the most people using NFTs (5M users).**

![](https://i.imgur.com/d7fhQsI.png)

Rio de Janeiro stands out as a crypto hub. In June, the 1st international NFT event in Brazil took place in the city. Gathering renowned Brazilian artists, collections of different styles and lectures about web3, NFTs and DAOs, NFT Rio showed the potential of the Brazilian market.

The Nouns DAO featured as one of the main collections during the event. [After the approval of proposal 98](https://nouns.wtf/vote/98), [@beautyandpunk](https://twitter.com/beautyandpunk), [@leoclark](https://twitter.com/leoclark) and [@fabioseva](https://twitter.com/fabioseva) did a great job spreading the noun culture at the conference. We want to further develop this work.

![](https://i.imgur.com/mohS5HA.png)

For this, the plan is to:
## 1) Promote 4 educational workshops about web3 in Gigoia Island, Rio de Janeiro/RJ.

![](https://i.imgur.com/x4A8LV0.png)
*Bob Burnquist with the teenagers from the Skate Cuida Institute*

The workshops are divided in 4 stages:
**a) Wallets and tokens:** first, a “magic trick” makes money disappear… and reappear inside the pocket of an attendee. The instructor explains what are “the secret crypto words”, how they can “control magic internet money”, and how anyone - even kids - can earn, use or store such money.

**b) NFTs:** the instructor shows attendees how digital wallets can hold other digital stuff. A series of these valuable things have been scattered through the Skate Cuida Institute (QR codes linking to a minting page). A treasure hunt leads attendees to earn their first NFTs.

**c) DAO:** the instructor shows a site where they can use their NFTs as tickets to join a club. He tells them there is a proposal there where they can vote for a prize that will be distributed either to half the “club”… or to all of its members - depending on how they vote it. The instructor reveals the results (awarding a prize in crypto to every participant) and teaches basic concepts in cooperation and game theory. He tells the audience the workshop was sponsored by a “club”, too - NounsDAO - that collaborates online to do cool stuff in the real world. And incites attendees they can do the same via the club they now belong to.

**d) Skate & Lunch:** to wrap things up, Bob Burnquist invites the kids for a ride on the Institute’s track, then **food and drinks** are served for all.

We plan to bring 30 kids in each workshop. The goal is to **introduce 120 people to crypto and NFTs** via Nouns DAO.

The end goal is to find a format ([presentation here](https://www.canva.com/design/DAFHzoOmwAE/OhifeRzHPUSLD7X1YLORVQ/view?utm_content=DAFHzoOmwAE&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link&utm_source=publishpresent)) that can be replicated in other communities in a cost-effective way.

**The workshops will be conducted by guiriba, a member of Paradigma Education**. Paradigma is a crypto research house in Brazil with experience ranging from [materials for beginners](https://paradigma.docsend.com/view/vzysv4pg3evfqry9) to courses to [analysis for experts.](https://app.paradigma.education/feed/post/view?id=kru2M8m98ePrweKAjXeu)

## 2) Nounify the skateboard track of Gigoia Island, Rio de Janeiro/RJ.

![](https://i.imgur.com/5iJAROf.png)

***Left:** [Bob Burnquist at the skate park](https://oglobo.globo.com/rio/bairros/niteroi/noticia/2022/06/bob-burnquist-leva-projeto-social-para-o-caramujo-em-niteroi.ghtml). Right: the Brazilian version of Skater Noun was created by [Ozzz](https://twitter.com/ozzzmabro), member of the [Mafriends](https://twitter.com/MafriendsArt) collective.*

While the workshop takes place, Nouns artwork by Brazilian artists will be painted at the Skate Cuida Institute, where classes are taught by Bob Burnquist.
We will bring a film crew and later deliver a clip registering the workshops and painting action.

## 3) Make a donation to the Skate Cuida Institute.

Purchase 3 VR headsets and 3 notebooks for the institute, to support the 4 weekly encounters currently held there, where kids receive cognitive training, skateboarding lessons, food and a safe space to play.

### What is the Skate Cuida Institute and who is Bob Burnquist?

Bob Burnquist is the greatest X-Games winner in history.

A Brazilian skateboarder & ex-videogame star, he now aims to empower unprivileged communities through sports, education and technology.

Skate Cuida Institute is a place in Rio with modest infrastructure where Bob and his team receive dozens of youngsters a week to study and skate together.

Bob is also avowedly a crypto-native. In 2021, he launched his first NFT collection, [Burnquist Gold.](https://twitter.com/bobburnquist/status/1446965292836524039) A fan of the Tezos blockchain, Bob has also experimented with Ethereum.

![](https://i.imgur.com/5hWMyOY.png)

Source: [Viva o Rio.](http://vivario.org.br/bob-burnquist-oferece-oficina-de-skate-no-parque-esportivo-e-social-do-caramujo/)

### **What is the motivation for Nouns DAO to fund the proposal?**

1) To foster web3 proficiency among teenagers from Rio de Janeiro communities.
2) To bring Nouns culture to young people having their first contact with the world of NFTs.
3) To seek media exposure in newspapers like O Globo, with [more than 25M readers and 185M monthly views](https://oglobo.globo.com/politica/o-globo-foi-jornal-mais-lido-do-pais-em-2021-25376960); and social media like that of Bob Burnquist, who has more than [160K followers on Twitter](https://twitter.com/bobburnquist) and [770K on Instagram.](https://www.instagram.com/bobburnquist/)
4) Create a cc0 educational material for communities around the world, allowing anyone to translate it and use it to teach web3 to children using Nouns.

### **How much will the action cost?**
**1) 3.5 ETH for the web3 educational program at the Skate Cuida Institute.**
 
- 1.2 ETH: airdrops for the attendees during the 4 workshops (120 x 0.01 ETH per person). The amount in ETH sent to the teens will be done via Polygon. A local business will be on the location, selling snacks and accepting crypto as payment.
- 2.3 ETH: event expenses:
\t- 1 ETH for instructor’s transport and accommodation: will be 4 weeks traveling from Minas Gerais to Rio de Janeiro. He will travel to Rio de Janeiro every week, just to give the workshops.
\t- 1 ETH for to organize breakfast, lunch, and afternoon coffee for the teenagers to spend the day at the Skate Cuida Institute
\t- 0.3 ETH for the costs of printing QR Codes on the skateboard track.
\t- 0.7 ETH for to pay the instructor in charge of workshops.

**2) 3 ETH for the artistic initiative.**

- 1 ETH: The money will be used to pay Brazilian artists who will create Brazilian versions of the Nouns. 0.2 ETH will be paid to each of the chosen artists, making it possible to create 5 unique arts. One of them is already created.
- 1 ETH: destined to purchase the materials used in the painting
- 1 ETH: to the artist responsible for painting the Noun on the institute’s skate track. In each of the workshops he will be present, nounifying the skateboard track of the Skate Cuida Institute with the artists’ designs.

**3) Donation of 4 ETH to the Skate Cuida Institute.**
- 1 ETH: for maintenance of the skateboard track at the Institute while the workshops are happening.
- 3 ETH: equipment to encourage teenagers to [learn about web3:](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UDuKAded86Y)
\t- 3x AR Oculus Quest 2 (to introduce concepts of virtual worlds more easily and foster the creation of 3D art).
\t- 3x Notebook [Ideapad 3i:](https://www.kabum.com.br/produto/254192/notebook-lenovo-ultrafino-ideapad-3i-intel-core-i3-10110u-4gb-ssd-256gb-windows-11-15-6-prata-82bs000jbr?gclid=CjwKCAjwrNmWBhA4EiwAHbjEQI7OaPM7XOhSlqUKD_bRjiN5Pf-8Ty16Ulmszeq3mRP6yCQZvgTZWxoCft0QAvD_BwE) to allow the classes that already take place at the institute to handle more students per lesson.

**4) 2 ETH for film crew to cover the workshop and further publicize the initiative.**

Therefore, **we require 12.5 ETH** for the execution of all the actions listed above."

title: nounish ⌐◨-◨  – Telling the stories of Nouns DAO through videos
description:
# nounish ⌐◨-◨  – Telling the stories of Nouns DAO through videos

**TL;DR**
* **Fund *nounish*, a creative agency dedicated to telling the story of Nouns, and the stories of its builders, through video.**
* A team of 10 people; Essentially dedicating Pixel, Goldy’s production company, to Nouns full time.
* Lead by Goldy & 142.
* 6 months of operations.
* $969K requested.

### Summary
* **Long-term Vision:** Help make Nouns a highly recognizable brand globally and inspire ambitious builders to build on the protocol. 
* **Objectives for this proposal:**  
	1. Help anyone who is curious about Nouns, including non-crypto audiences, ***understand* what Nouns is about**.
	2. Onboard new builders & inspire current builders to **make ambitious and impactful proposals**.
	3. Rally the Nouns community around projects that we've funded and **empower it to share our content**. 
	4. Enable builders to use our content to **ease interactions with brands & non-crypto organizations**.
* **Strategy: Focus on Middle of Funnel (read more below)**
	* Make our [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCP4kPIzNhpTGrn75XeLVVXg) an **onboarding tool to Nouns DAO**.
		* Make the channel's page a shareable, digestible, and entertaining repository of videos that cover what Nouns DAO does and funds.
	* Produce & publish **high quality videos about the most promising projects Nouns DAO funds**, to tell their stories in an accessible way.
	* Publish dozens of **"Nouns Explainers"** covering the many layers of Nouns.
	* Keep a pulse on projects' progress and **share compelling updates on our social media accounts daily**.
* **Measuring Success**
	* We want to spend the next 6 months experimenting with different types of video formats, channels, storytelling, and more.
	* We will track the most relevant metrics to understand what works and what doesn't. Aside from reach (views), here are some key metrics we plan to measure: 
		*  **Builder recruitment** (how many people get noun-pilled thanks to our content and join our community?)
		*  **Content leverage** (how frequently and in what ways is our content used by other builders to further the DAO's interests?)
		*  **Content proliferation** (how and where our videos get re-uploaded, remixed, or used in a new context)
		*  **Video retention** (when & why do people drop in our videos?)
		*  **View sources** (where do poeople come from to watch our videos?)
	*  We will share these metrics publicly to engage the community and learn together.
* **Deliverables**
	* 8-10 high production value long-form videos (similar to [these](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eAenRhD8Whk) [ones](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S_GgY3WAKAQ)).
	* 140+ short form videos (similar to [these](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1539991656988114946) [ones](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1547686340564697088)).
	* Daily posts sharing updates from builders on our social media accounts (examples [1](https://www.instagram.com/reel/Ch49qrcItt8/) [2](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1566003680482148353) [3](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1565058557829070848))
	* Publish a CC0 video bank with our raw footage for anyone to use.
* **Accountability**
	* **Form a Steering Committee:** comprising of 4156 & 2 more trusted community members or subject matter experts.
		* Provide this committee with frequent updates on our strategy and get their feedback & guidance. We want this committee to keep us accountable.  
	* **Community involvement:** Monthly reports + open discord call with the DAO.
* **Staffing & Resources**
	* A team of 6 full-timers & 4 part-timers (142, Goldy & the entire Pixel team)
	* At least 10 shoot days around the world.


# Prop 64 recap
With [Prop 64](https://nouns.wtf/vote/64) we were funded to the tune of 40 ETH ($109K)  for a pilot to publish 4 long-form videos that tell the stories of our builders.  

## What we've delivered

### Long-form Videos
* **3 videos were published**
	* [Dustin Yellin's giant glass sculpture for Nouns DAO](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eAenRhD8Whk)
	* [Free Glasses for Kids Who Need Them](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S_GgY3WAKAQ)
	* [Funding Extreme Athletes with GnarsDAO](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1569692294529581056) 
* **1 additional video will be published very soon**
	* Naming a Frog "Nouns" & donating to rain forest conservation 

[![](https://i.imgur.com/rNZ4b4A.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eAenRhD8Whk)

[![](https://i.imgur.com/zZBE0VR.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S_GgY3WAKAQ&t) 

[![](https://i.imgur.com/XZkr6Ul.jpg)](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1569692294529581056)


### CC0 Raw Footage Bank
In a few days we will be putting raw footage from our shoot days with Salvino, Gnars, Dustin Yellin, and Free Glasses projects. 

* We would like to see our footage used by other builders and content creators for their needs
* Our vision is for this footage bank to be used in the future for documentaries and other content produced about nouns

### Overdelivered
* ["What's nounish?"](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1523988962955919371) teaser video 
[![](https://i.imgur.com/lN60utl.png)](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1523988962955919371)

* [The “on-chain version of the American dream” -- Salvino](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1539991656988114946)
[![](https://i.imgur.com/PDOI9kb.jpg)](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1539991656988114946)
* [Carve your own path with @nounsdao funding](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1547686340564697088)
[![](https://i.imgur.com/OdF5b9N.jpg)](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1547686340564697088)
* [Gnars DAO teaser](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/iKq3E0VnG-k)

[![](https://i.imgur.com/R8J5H4q.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/iKq3E0VnG-k)

* Pitched Nouns DAO on [Alex Lieberman's page](https://twitter.com/businessbarista/status/1547645567546716167)

[![](https://i.imgur.com/Zpfl5vL.png)](https://twitter.com/businessbarista/status/1547645567546716167)

* Created real-time activations and shared content from NFT.NYC (including the iconic [gnars photo](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1539284867241869319) and [skateboard giveaway](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1539368308985802754), and a spontaneous activation by Salvino at the [conference's lobby](https://twitter.com/nounish/status/1539727213095944193))
* Daily updates from our builders on our growing [instagram](https://www.instagram.com/thats_nounish/) & [twitter](https://twitter.com/nounish) pages.
* Our twitter account has received more than 644,000 impressions since starting it in June.
* We've had over 90,000 views on our videos across all platforms.


## Our content is used to help other builders
Our videos have helped other DAO members to explain nouns to non-crypto audiences:

* Studio1 meetings
![](https://i.imgur.com/wC48xiI.png)
* [Gnars.com](https://gnars.com/) features video on homepage and shared heaps of the content we've captured and created on Twitter
* [Kenya ads in Nairoby square](https://twitter.com/okinawacircus/status/1538918162846081025)
* [NFT Rio](https://twitter.com/MafriendsArt/status/1543700537882845186)
* [Video on NYC mural website](https://nycnouns.com/)


## Our content is shared by large organizations
![](https://i.imgur.com/e9eqZqm.jpg)

# The next 6 months

## The Challenges We Want To Tackle

[From Prop 64:](https://nouns.wtf/vote/64)
> * Prop builders don’t necessarily have the skills/resources/time to execute a marketing campaign for their projects.
> * Wonderful projects with really great output are not being amplified and we are missing out on a lot of noun proliferation potential.
> * It’s difficult to explain what Nouns are to the world. 

We believe that the problems we outlined in Prop 64 still exist. Most of the amazing projects that Nouns funds need help telling their story, and video is the best way to do so.

It is safe to assume that without the videos we published, Nouns DAO would have missed the opportunity of amplifying the stories of these wonderful projects. 

With video, we are able to tell a much deeper and colorful story and evoke much more emotion. We believe this must be 10Xed to recruit more builders to help the meme proliferate. 

## The Nouns Funnel

We think of builder & community onboarding as a funnel: 



* **Top of Funnel**: People who heear about Nouns from a friend, stumble upon a Nouns project in their city, enjoy a piece of nouns art on twitter etc. 
* **Middle of Funnel**: People who become curious to understand what Nouns are, want to learn how to get funded, or want to join the community.
* **Bottom of Funnel**: People who are ready to submit a proposal, buy a noun (or nounlet), or to join the community or a sub DAO.


In the next 6 months we want to focus on the **Middle of the Funnel**. We want to help explain what Nouns are to the world and get many more people noun-pilled. 

**Why focus on Middle of Funnel first and not Top of Funnel?**

The majority of people that have heard of Nouns do not really grok what it is, never-mind all the potential builders outside the NFT bubble that we are missing out on because it’s too esoteric to dive in to. In reality, almost no one gets what we’re doing, and it’s impossible for them to have a vision for Nouns.

The hurdle to understand what Nouns is and how to interact with the community is absurdly high for someone not native to our ecosystem.

It’s imperative that there’s quality consumable content out there that helps people **not only understand what Nouns is doing but be inspired to join in**. What we need is social media channels (eg. YouTube and Instagram) that have a significant catalogue of content you can just sit and consume. 

* We are going to try to answer questions that are not easily answered today like:
	* **“So what does nouns actually do and stand for?"**
		* This is a branding exercise, this is key for our work to answer.
	* **“What is Nouns actually to me?”**
		* The answer is not NFTs, or a DAO (that is just infrastructure), it's an open source brand that you can be funded to build on (or build on permissionlessly). It’s an energised and broad community. It’s a movement. We need to demonstrate this through our videos.
	* **“What’s a nounish concept / proposal?”**
		* Current way to understand this: read hundreds of proposals on nouns.wtf/vote, tally their results, investigate if they were “successful” or not, if the dao likes them, analyse all this data… etc. What if instead they could watch a handful of nounish videos that show the things we’re proud of?
	* **“How do I get funded?”**
		* Videos about this will be hugely valuable, currently it takes a lot of effort to understand this. Our top priority here is to make a few videos focused exclusively on getting funded via Prop House and then other videos about the other ways as a whole, and individual videos on specifics (on chain, nsfw etc.)
	* **“Can it be any cultural domain?”**
		* Here are some screenshots from version 1 of our intro. We will continue to experiment and iterate with ways to tell this story all the time. This is hugely important to be understood if we want to experiment in every vertical.

![](https://i.imgur.com/xeVv9Yh.jpg)

## What we will deliver as part of this prop

![](https://i.imgur.com/VfTyQw4.gif)


### Nounish across all social networks

We will spend the next 6 months churning out high quality video content about Nouns and its builders. 

We plan to work on all major Social Media networks. We have started building a following on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nounish) and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/thats_nounish/). We will also invest more cycles into building out our [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100082280520913) & [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@thats_nounish) presence. 

But our main focus will be on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/nounish), where you can expect our channel to become the easiest way to get into the Nouns rabbit hole and come out understanding all the key concepts of the DAO, as well as learn about the most inspiring projects being built on the protocol.

![](https://i.imgur.com/mJGFJA6.jpg)
*Our YouTube channel will become a video learning hub for everything nouns-related*

### Videos about the most inspiring proposals

There are so many amazing stories to tell about nouns-funded projects that can get so much more depth with good video content covering them. 

Here are some of the proposals we would love to make content about! 

![](https://i.imgur.com/8t1RQ4Q.gif)

**LONG FORM Candidates (not exhaustive)**
* Rose parade / Stoopid Buddy
* E Sports
* Nouns Fashion: Nouns Brand & Dopamine & Danit Peleg & Madhappy
* Xanadu
* Prop House
* Dustin Ep 2
* Free Glasses Ep 2
* Edible Nouns: Moonbeans + Nouns Coffee
* Children's Book
* Luxury Glasses
* NounWorks: Fun Frames, Pins, etc.
* The Wizard's Hat
* Sofubi Dolls
* The Noun Square
* Nounish

**SHORT FORM Candidates (not exhaustive)**
* Mucho Love
* John Hamon
* Noundry
* Nouns front ends
* Nouns Brazil
* Nouns Comics
* CC0 Spacebank
* Bidder POAP
* Goat Club / Memes
* 3D Nouns
* iOS App
* Coloring Books
* Super Bowl commercial
* Murals, posters, art around the world


### Nouns Explained (bitesized & long-form)

We want to make it easy for anyone to understand Nouns and the DAO. And specifically, we want to help onboard potential builders. 

We will create a suite of high quality videos explaining the key concepts of Nouns.

Some of the concepts we would like to produce videos for:
* What is Prop House and how to get funded
* What can you build on Nouns?
* What is Noun O'Clock
* What is FOMO and how does it work
* What is CC0?
* How do props get funded?
* Where to start with Nouns DAO?
* How does the Nouns auction work?
* What happens when you join Nouns DAO? (so you joined Nouns DAO... what next?)
* How does voting (governance) of Nouns DAO work?

## Who are we

![](https://i.imgur.com/HNkWdjf.jpg)
*142 & Goldy*

### [142](https://twitter.com/1fortytwo)
Noun-pilled marketer/product/growth person. Involved in the Nouns community since Noun #2. 
* Co-Founded “The Noun Square” (Prop 101)
* Builder of “The Noun O’Clock Client” prop.house proposal #777
* Built Prop 4 as part of the Verbs team
* Started & led a dozen Weekly Nouner World Call

### [Goldy](https://twitter.com/Goldypix)
Filmmaker & production studio owner. Community member since TestNet. 
* Founder of [SharkDAO](https://twitter.com/sharkdao)
* Founder of [GOAT Club](https://tenor.com/users/goldypix) (100+ nounish reaction gifs and Mixed Nouns 
* Creator and lead of Prop 20 - [Nouns Stories](https://twitter.com/nouns_stories) (1st motion storytelling prop, premiering 1st short film soon!)
* Noundry project committee member

### [Pixel](https://www.pixel.melbourne/)
Pixel is a renowned boutique production company based in Melbourne, Australia. They’re experts in making tricky things happen, and believe that clever, complex, and wonderful ideas need nurturing from beginning to end. So they script, design, shoot, animate and finish projects in-house. They have worked across campaigns for world class brands including Adidas, Coca Cola, Toyota, Target, and Sesame Street.


![](https://i.imgur.com/7CKKsk5.jpg)
*Goldy, Haley, and John*


## Our Team
* **142**: Lead / Growth / Builder Relations
	* 142 has built & marketed products that have grown from 0 to 100s of millions of users. He has led marketing teams in multiple successful startups. He loves identifying trends early and telling about them to the world. Working on Nouns is a perfect fit for 142 as he thrives most at the intersection of art, community, and tech. 
* **Goldy**: Lead / Creative Director / Editor
	* Goldy is an Oscar shortlisted filmmaker with over a decade's experience as a commercial director known for striking style and experimental techniques. Goldy joined Pixel as a partner in 2017. His obsession with Nouns has evolved from an odd quirk to a passion that has changed Pixel’s trajectory.
* **John Gavin**: Creative Director / Editor
	* John is the Co-founder of Pixel and has run the business for 16 years. He’s a storyteller, known for his polished, design-driven projects. His practice blurs the lines between animation, technology, and design. John is a hardcore space-enthusiast who mixes up a mean negroni. He has been noun-pilled by his own work on Nounish (now the proud owner of a pair of Nouns Vision glasses in classic red).
* **Haley Polacik**: Executive Producer
	* Haley has over 15 years experience producing film shoots, post production, and animation. As an award winning Exec Producer and Partner at Pixel for the past decade her skills and knowledge are essentially boundless. Haley’s skills even extend to being the best at fill-your-glass-up-as-high-as-possible-without-spilling-it which, in a studio rife with completely ridiculous competitive games, is no small feat.
* **Meline Samson**: Producer / Editor
	* Meline is an impassioned storyteller, and lover of cinema. For her it’s all about the harmony between the narrative and aesthetic. She brings her french elegance and eye for details to the table with 10 years of experience as a producer she knows how to make things done with accuracy and kindness. As a frenchy living in Australia she is the ambassador of cheese ‘o clock at Pixel. 
* **Guy Franklin**: Director / Editor (part time)
	* Guy loves big ideas that seem a little scary at first. He’s a specialist in visuals with movement, colour and stories that explore humanity. He’s very comfortable on both the tennis court and the d-floor.
* **Rebecca Moore**: Producer (part time)
	*  Bec is the organisational heart of Pixel. She manages the studio, produces, copywrites, makes a sweet charcuterie platter. With a background in film and creative writing, and a masters in Arts Management, Bec combines fierce organisation and creativity in he role as producer at Pixel. Aside from being a multi-tasking kween, she also sings in an a cappella group and has a Nouns musical percolating in her brain just waiting to be unleashed.
* **Liam Gordes**: Editor (part time)
	* Liam has been directing and editing for screen for the past decade, ranging from short films to web series, and TV commercials.  Liam is a big believer in the power of collaboration.
* **Dylan Hornsby**: Editor (part time)
	* Dylan is educated in marketing but has honed his craft as a filmmaker over the past decade, creating award winning shorts films, online content, and TV commercials. Creative problem solving is a sport for Dylan.
* **Hiring**: Social Media Admin

## Steering Committee

We will form a 3-person steering committee to help us deal with strategic dilemmas, get feedback on our work, and help us get expert advice on social media growth strategies.

4156 has graciously agreed to be on this committee. We are seeking and speaking to other potential candidates who are subject matter experts (we are specifically looking for a YouTube content & growth expert).


## Budget
* **Team Compensation + Fixed Costs** - $775K 
* **10+ Shoot Days Globally** - $113K
* **Growth Experiments (ads, platform-specific experts)** - $24K
* **Travel (NFT London, Rose Parade, and 2 more TBD)** - $21.5K
* **Steering Committee Stipend ($1k/mo per member)** - $18K 
* **Legal & forex fees** - $17.5K

**Total: $969K** 


## Period of Engagement
* 6 months: November 7th, 2022 -> May 7th, 2023

## Payment Terms
* $320K up front on receipt of funds (1/3 of funds)
* $649K in a stream that will start on November 7 and will end on March 7th, 2023 (2/3 of funds over 4 months).


## Multisig Receiving Funds

The receiving address is a Gnosis Safe with 3/5 signers. 

**Multisig address:** 0x8a4eb8f3383909a8138101F6E17cd8281a26eA3a

**Multisig signers:**
* **[elad](https://www.nounsagora.com/delegate/delegate.el4d.eth):** 0xfe9b3ab16AfeF3B28C0c3dfA6fa7C5b58f5c06aA 
* **[krel](https://www.nounsagora.com/delegate/krel.eth):** 0xFFb0E93F7e315BECcF0757845F3eF2cB9832efB9
* **[maty](https://www.nounsagora.com/delegate/maty.eth):** maty.eth
* 9999: 0x6223Bc5fd16a19bcFAe2281dDE47861CFE1023eE
* 142: 0xE6232ed3436C4065D38D8BFdC8EA90858ecDfa69

$969,000 USD = ~740 ETH (@ 1ETH = $1,311 USD)
Adding 20% buffer for volatility: 888 ETH

*If, due to high volatility, insufficient ETH is available to cover the proposed budget, another proposal will be put on chain to top up the difference.*

## Multisig Plan

1. Upon receipt of funds, signers will convert the ETH to $969K USDC. 
2. $320,000 USDC will be sent to nounish's multisig (0x49a5aEec7d9AC70990404278e93031E4C3C71875).
3. A Sablier stream for $649,000 USDC will be set up to start on November 7, 2022 and will end on March 7th, 2023.
4. Leftover ETH will be sent to NounsDAO treasury.

title: One-Click Bots for the Nouns Ecosystem
description:
# One-Click Bots for the Nouns Ecosystem

**TL;DR** Enable any Nouns-derivative to launch customizable bots in minutes, with no code.

---

**How is this different from existing bots?**
No coding required! Fully customizable bots capable of sharing full spectrum of DAO's activity - New Proposals, Votes, Auctions, Secondary Sales, Listings, Collection Analytics etc.

**Who is this for?**
Any existing or future Nounish projects. 


---
Our Twitter and Discord bot would share ALL Nouns contract events, including proposals, auctions, votes, sales, and more. And with a simplified UI, any Nounish project can launch a customized bot in minutes in three easy steps:

1. **Connect the bot's social account to BotFrens**
2. **Specify Nounish contract address**
3. **Select behaviors the bot will perform**

We know that this sounds too simple, but we have the experience and tech chops to make it happen! We even built a prototype to illustrate how this will work: **YouTube Demo [https://youtu.be/2hjr5YcPGQg](https://youtu.be/2hjr5YcPGQg)**

![](https://i.imgur.com/JkpVeLM.png)


This is [Andrei](https://twitter.com/andreitr) and [Cody](https://twitter.com/itscodybraun) and we are the founders of [BotFrens](https://botfrens.com). Over the last year we launched bots for a number of NOUNISH projects, NFT Marketplaces, hundreds of individual creators, and we are excited to build something powerful for the Nouns ecosystem ⌐◨-◨

---
**Simplified Technical Overview**
BotFrens listens to events emitted from a Nounish contract, saves and aggregates emitted data, applies user-defined templates, and shares content to a specified social channel.

![](https://i.imgur.com/V4UwIn9.png)


---

**Bot Behaviors and Events**
✅ Behaviors already working on [BotFrens](https://botfrens.com)

![](https://i.imgur.com/n748Yq2.png)

---

**Dev Timeline**
10-8 weeks after funding:
* NFT Behaviors: **2 weeks**
* DAO Behaviors: **4 weeks**
* BotFrens UI integration: **1 week**
* Discord Integration: **2 weeks**
* Refinement tweaks: **2 weeks**

---

**Budget**

* Initial Development: **25 ETH**
* Refinement / Bugfixes / Support: **10 ETH**
* Infrastructure Setup: **5 ETH**
* Total: **40 ETH**

---

**Proposed Transaction**

0x997953c94aC188051A8cf4318E6Cd90eC48fB795.transfer( 40 ETH )

---


**Deliverables**
* Integrate all events / behaviors with the [Nouns Bot](https://twitter.com/nouns_bot)
* Migrate [Lost Nous](https://twitter.com/lostnouns_bot) and [Lil Nouns](https://twitter.com/lilnouns_bot) bots to BotFrens
* Fully functional Nounish Bot management via BotFrens UI

---

**Team**

For the past seven years, [Andrei](https://twitter.com/andreitr) and [Cody](https://twitter.com/itscodybraun) have been using bots to help artists, museums, and art marketplaces share their collections on social media. Their bots are followed by 6.3M accounts on Twitter and have shared millions of posts. Some of the bots:

* [Nouns](https://twitter.com/nouns_bot)
* [Lost Nouns](https://twitter.com/lostnouns_bot)
* [Lil Nouns](https://twitter.com/lilnouns_bot)
* [Noadz](https://twitter.com/thenoadz_bot)
* [Boneys](https://twitter.com/theboneys_bot)
* [Foundation](https://twitter.com/foundation_bot)
* [Art Blocks](https://twitter.com/artblocks_bot)
* [BrainDrops](https://twitter.com/braindrops_bot)
* [Claude Monet](https://twitter.com/artistmonet)
* [Vincent Van Gogh](https://twitter.com/vangoghartist)
* [Tate](https://twitter.com/TateArtBot)
* [The MET](https://twitter.com/met_modernart)
* ... [and hundreds more](https://t.co/artbots)


---

**Press about BotFrens**
[WIRED: Why Twitter Can Be a Perfect Portfolio for Artists](https://www.wired.com/story/why-twitter-perfect-artists-portfolio/)
[Twitter Blog: The secret world of good bots](https://blog.twitter.com/common-thread/en/topics/stories/2021/the-secret-world-of-good-bots)
[Art News: Meet the Man Filling Twitter with Art](https://www.artnews.com/art-news/news/andreit-taraschuk-art-bots-1234608132/)
[Observer: The Social Media Bots Flooding Twitter Feeds With Culture](https://observer.com/2021/08/social-media-art-bots-twitter/)

title: Noundry Community Compensation
description:
# Noundry Community Compensation

This proposal aims to retroactively compensate the Noundry community for their part in making Season 0 a success. Total ask of 25 eth.

We believe the community is largely to thank for making Noundry into something more than a mere contest. Instead, the Noundry evolved into a collaborative experience — a festival — where artists from around the world came together to inspire and build upon each other's ideas, using Nouns pixel art as a canvas to unite around.

The artwork we eventually added to the Nouns Descriptor contract resulted from a group effort and would not have been the same without the participation of the larger community.

With this proposal, we want to acknowledge that the collaborative, explorative side of the Noundry is as vital as the outcome and hope to set an example for upcoming Noundrys.

## Compensation

### Community compensation

We think community compensation is best left to the community to decide. The alternatives would be equal distribution to all participants or attempting the almost impossible task of centrally deciding who had a meaningful impact on the Noundry. None of these options feel exciting or in the spirit of the Noundry.

To manage this, we're using [Coordinape](https://coordinape.com/), a community compensation platform, and want to allocate a pool of 24 eth for the Noundry season 0 community to split up amongst themselves.
 

**Coordinape rules**
- Participants eligible to vote: [https://hackmd.io/@krel/noundry-coordinape](https://hackmd.io/@krel/noundry-coordinape)
- Each participant receives three votes
- Participants allocate votes based on who they think had the largest positive impact on their own experience
- Participants cannot vote for themselves
- Participants cannot vote for artists with winning traits in Noundry Season 0
    - Facu, Gremplin, Goldy, Modrovsky, LuckyCryptoCats, Fuyu, Nountris

**Total: 24 eth**

### Summary
- Coordinape round: 24 eth
- Administration (run by maty): 1 eth
- **Total compensation: 25 eth**

### Transactions
-  1 eth to maty
    -  0x3E3928d651b431608F81Dd1129a56344d6A256EC
-  24 eth to Gnosis Safe with 3/5 signers
    -  0x8a4eb8f3383909a8138101F6E17cd8281a26eA3a

**Multisig signers**

- (maty) 0xDEAD753f9B1eb8F2f7372E8587e7C6e342daac89
- (krel) 0xFFb0E93F7e315BECcF0757845F3eF2cB9832efB9
- (elad) 0xfe9b3ab16AfeF3B28C0c3dfA6fa7C5b58f5c06aA
- (9999) 0x6223Bc5fd16a19bcFAe2281dDE47861CFE1023eE
- (142)  0xE6232ed3436C4065D38D8BFdC8EA90858ecDfa69

title: Noundry Winners & Committee Compensation
description:
# Noundry Winners & Committee Compensation

**This proposal aims to retroactively compensate winning artists and the curation committee of the first Noundry. Total ask of 142.69 eth.**

We believe that Noundry compensation is more than a box-ticking exercise. Pixel art is part of who we are; it's in our bones, and adding new pixels to the Descriptor contract is a big deal. It's an opportunity to celebrate nounishness, reinforce our culture, and create new traditions.

We want the Noundry to become a continuous event, a new tradition, and a significant driver of Nouns proliferation within artistic circles. In that light, the compensation outlined in this proposal is not just about the work that was completed, but also about future signaling.

We think one of the most exciting possible outcomes of the Noundry would be if every artist in the world aspires to put their artwork into the Nouns contract (and by extension, the public domain). And while high compensation may not be the primary motivator, it can help initiate the right feedback loop and create the breeding ground needed for future Noundrys to thrive.

## Compensation

### Winner compensation
*[https://nouns.wtf/vote/125](https://nouns.wtf/vote/125) (Integrate 8/8 Anniversary Art)*

Noundry Season 0 winners are compensated per winning trait. Artists with multiple winning submissions are rewarded for each submission.

Noun Head traits are more generously compensated as they are the most visually striking, tend to create the most excitement within the community, and are responsible for driving much of the Twitter discourse and enthusiasm around the Noundry.

- **Head trait winners**
    - Facu x 3 (Snowman, Vending Machine, Wine Barrel)
    - Gremplin x 2 (Capybara, Treasure Chest)
    - LuckyCryptoCats x 1 (Hanger)
    - Goldy x 1 (Couch)
    - Modrovsky x 1 (Index Card)
- **Accessory trait winners**
    - Fuyu x 2 (Uroko, Tatewaku)
    - JMA Nountris x 1 (Grease)

*Note: Gremplin declined compensation for the two glasses traits added in the upgrade, arguing that there should be a minimum degree of effort required for compensation.*

**Winning traits compensation**
- Heads: 15 eth / trait
    - (8 x 15 = 120 eth)
- Accessories: 4 eth / trait
    - (3 x 4 = 12 eth)
- **Total: 132 eth**

### Curation committee compensation
The curation committee played a crucial role in making Noundry Season 0 a success. They are compensated for organizing the event, curating, and fine-tuning the winning contributions. 

It's hard to put a figure value on the committee's efforts — in many ways it's priceless. We propose compensating the committee with a symbolic sum of 10.69 eth to distribute as they see fit.

- Committee members for Season 0:
    - Goldy
    - Gremplin
    - 4156
    - 9999
    - Solimander
- **Total: 10.69 eth**

### Summary
- Winner compensation: 132 eth
- Committee: 10.69 eth
- **Total compensation: 142.69 eth**

### Transactions
- 45 eth to Facu
    - 0x82d1f493FeB2639318045f2C5dDd4B1d0653aa29
- 30 eth to Gremplin
    - 0x4298e663517593284Ad4FE199b21815BD48a9969
- 15 eth to Goldy
    - 0x021edd67d43B365a6401a5Ee704Aa6f264F3F4e4
- 15 eth to LuckyCryptoCats
    - 0xD840369402683782263511d76C99e9D50Dc37D2C
- 15 eth to Modrovsky
    - 0xb8a9Ed8D008FA1F161809f15a11F4161FB8b717e
- 8 eth to Fuyu
    - 0x4F4bD77781cEeE4914B6bC16633D5437eaBCa5D3
- 4 eth to JMA Nountris
    - 0x55a25cce1737E4692Fc243B6C26364DAED7f2486
- 10.69 eth to Gnosis Safe with 3/5 signers
    -  0x8a4eb8f3383909a8138101F6E17cd8281a26eA3a

**Multisig signers**

- (maty) 0xDEAD753f9B1eb8F2f7372E8587e7C6e342daac89
- (krel) 0xFFb0E93F7e315BECcF0757845F3eF2cB9832efB9
- (elad) 0xfe9b3ab16AfeF3B28C0c3dfA6fa7C5b58f5c06aA
- (9999) 0x6223Bc5fd16a19bcFAe2281dDE47861CFE1023eE

title: Agora continuation
description:
# Agora continuation
*Note: for full discussion of the prop on discourse, please see this [link](https://discourse.nouns.wtf/t/proposal-agora-continuation/2478).*

## TL;DR

We’d like to seek funding for a quarter (3 months) to keep developing [Agora](https://www.nounsagora.com/) in order to improve the governance efficacy of Nouns through delegation.

## Progress so far

We got [funded on August 31](https://prop.house/proposal/1023) via Prop House mandates to build an MVP. In less than one month, we’ve built a delegate platform for voters to broadcast what they want to see, and for builders to find voters who might support their prop. To illustrate the outcome with some numbers, so far we’ve seen:

* 17 statements from delegates representing 125 nouns (>25% of all votes!)
* 16 statements from builders who are seeking delegation
* 5 nouns delegated via Agora (that we know of)
* Proposal passed to [deploy a beta](https://lil-nouns-agora-dev.act.workers.dev/) on lil nouns

In sum, Agora has created a hub that turned delegation from an invisible, behind the scenes activity, to something the community can see, participate in, discuss, and improve upon.

## What’s next?

Our goal has always been to greatly improve the effectiveness of the Nouns DAO. We recognize that while the DAO lives and dies by the quality of its decision making, the time demand of being a good voter is such that we cannot expect most token holders to participate to the degree required. Therefore focusing on driving delegation of votes into the hands of qualified and engaged delegates is the highest leverage activity we can invest in – especially given that constant issuance means that delegation and governance engagement is naturally trending downwards.

Although creating a client like Agora to reduce friction and provide transparency is a necessary first step, we don’t think that alone will be enough to drive meaningful delegation. That’s why the next phase of Agora will not only continue to improve the delegation client, but also deliberately invest in programs and mechanisms that can greatly increase delegation and participation. We outline below the key areas we’ll focus on in the next phase of Agora.

## Focus areas

**Incentivize effective governance:** We believe there’s tremendous potential in creating incentives to reward effective governance, but also recognize the pitfalls of designing poor mechanisms. As such, we will be running a series of small scale incentive programs over the next months, with the goal of finding the best one to turn into a mechanism we can invest in for the long run. Below are some examples of incentive designs.

## TL;DR

We’d like to seek funding for a quarter (3 months) to keep developing [Agora](https://www.nounsagora.com/) in order to improve the governance efficacy of Nouns through delegation.

## Progress so far

We got [funded on August 31](https://prop.house/proposal/1023) via Prop House mandates to build an MVP. In less than one month, we’ve built a delegate platform for voters to broadcast what they want to see, and for builders to find voters who might support their prop. To illustrate the outcome with some numbers, so far we’ve seen:

* 17 statements from delegates representing 125 nouns (>25% of all votes!)
* 16 statements from builders who are seeking delegation
* 5 nouns delegated via Agora (that we know of)
* Proposal passed to [deploy a beta](https://lil-nouns-agora-dev.act.workers.dev/) on lil nouns

In sum, Agora has created a hub that turned delegation from an invisible, behind the scenes activity, to something the community can see, participate in, discuss, and improve upon.

## What’s next?

Our goal has always been to greatly improve the effectiveness of the Nouns DAO. We recognize that while the DAO lives and dies by the quality of its decision making, the time demand of being a good voter is such that we cannot expect most token holders to participate to the degree required. Therefore focusing on driving delegation of votes into the hands of qualified and engaged delegates is the highest leverage activity we can invest in – especially given that constant issuance means that delegation and governance engagement is naturally trending downwards.

Although creating a client like Agora to reduce friction and provide transparency is a necessary first step, we don’t think that alone will be enough to drive meaningful delegation. That’s why the next phase of Agora will not only continue to improve the delegation client, but also deliberately invest in programs and mechanisms that can greatly increase delegation and participation. We outline below the key areas we’ll focus on in the next phase of Agora.

## Focus areas

**Incentivize effective governance:** We believe there’s tremendous potential in creating incentives to reward effective governance, but also recognize the pitfalls of designing poor mechanisms. As such, we will be running a series of small scale incentive programs over the next months, with the goal of finding the best one to turn into a mechanism we can invest in for the long run. Below are some examples of incentive designs.

![|2048x774](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/eiFv84jejE5bSBZCCFgErnb3ObAkRrvTRvxgs-fl-MLfDqPKxy6vIruxfIifE5Z_3VgcA9QV-Mdpy7ilGZgy066F2rrFGQTzx1z5owX22ibVFN22kJfm5qb23eVA4froCqj1lFcniEeZXY8fC6fTgtFz6ygA6bw07PdpD0w2HxOUFRm8Abx0gPNm0A)

**Continue building the Agora app:** We’ll keep building the Agora client to create the best experience for Nouns governance participants, bar none. This means investing in features like: proposals view with reasons delegated voted for / against, more robust governance metrics over time, an easy to use proposal creator, granular and temporary delegation, etc.

**Continue building the Agora app:** We’ll keep building the Agora client to create the best experience for Nouns governance participants, bar none. This means investing in features like: proposals view with reasons delegated voted for / against, more robust governance metrics over time, an easy to use proposal creator, granular and temporary delegation, etc.

![|690x447](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/ct5TSYydfGy--YB6e9ZC9lC8RBUrZr_KHDSXt3MFbcelLeirAzAQmKH6R-XwFITGngWuKPZ4NOwHrSHz0pDgisjqW7g2htWLJKwllwg4otH-wgIblV9rTPZPgkIGiBdesa067Z7jL71NdMzS_EWkkHQXOQhPuLh0Oo237JMZr7yGZbTIezkoiosx)

**Operate a delegate drive program:** we recognize that one of the key ingredients of Prop House’s success was their investment in getting builders and voters to participate. Taking inspiration from that effort, we’ll also operate a program to get token holders and voters to participate on Agora.

## Outcomes in 4 months:

If we are successful, this is what things would look like in a quarter:

* A full fledged Agora app that is a more powerful version of Tally & nouns.wtf when it comes to voting and delegating.
* Strong conviction around the most effective mechanism to incentivize voter turnout
* More delegates and delegation from the delegate drive program and mechanism experiments

## Team

Yitong – Project lead & designer: co-founder of Vector DAO, and previously design + product at Coinbase. Prop builder for #87, contributor to Nouns Vision, delegate

0xcaff – Engineer: Built the v1 of Agora, previously engineer at Coinbase

Tom Taubkin – Protocol Engineer: Contributor to several defi projects, previously engineer at Coinbase

Mrtn – Ops / Community: Delegate from nounlets, funded via Prop House as governance historian, deployed Agora on lil nouns, previously pm on nouns.builder, and pm at Google

## Funding request

210 ETH to the team

20 ETH to incentivize voter participation

Total ask 255 ETH (of which 20 will be given back to community via participation incentives)

title: Agora continuation
description:
