title: Fund Trustless USDC Payments Contract
description:
# Fund Trustless USDC Payments Contract

## Summary

In order to pay builders directly with USDC, we have deployed a contract (`TokenBuyer`) which swaps ETH for USDC on behalf of the DAO.

We propose to fund `TokenBuyer` with 625 ETH in order to acquire a USDC buffer of $500K (there's a baked in volatility buffer; any extra ETH will be used for later proposals or can come back to the treasury).

Future proposals created from nouns.wtf will automatically "top off" TokenBuyer with additional ETH, minimizing the need for additional funding proposals.

## Motivation

Many proposals have costs in USD (or other fiat currencies) and would prefer to request USDC for the DAO instead of ETH.

It is not trivial to swap ETH to USDC at proposal execution time without being subjected to sandwich attacks and getting bad swap rates.

## Solution

The tech pod developed [TokenBuyer](https://github.com/nounsDAO/token-buyer) - a suite of smart contracts that allow permissionless swapping of tokens.

TokenBuyer will allow proposals to request payment amount in USDC.

The swapping of ETH to USDC happens asynchronously, meaning:
If the DAO doesn't have enough USDC on hand, it will register a debt for the remaining amount. As soon as the rest of the USDC is available, it is sent to the recipient's wallet, no user intervention needed. We expect this to take a few days at most, depending on the total amount.

TokenBuyer allows anyone to swap USDC for the ETH it holds. It uses Chainlink's ETH/USD price feed to set the price.

Whenever a proposal requests USDC from the DAO, it will also include a transaction to top up TokenBuyer with additional ETH, proportional to the USDC amount requested.

(*This "automatic top-off" is part of nouns.wtf; other governance clients can choose whether they implement this behavior*)

### Example:
* Builder A creates a proposal that requests 100,000 USDC
* 2 actions will be added to the proposal:
    1. Send 100K USDC from the TokenBuyer to Builder A
    2. Send $150K worth of ETH to TokenBuyer to swap for USDC
       * The extra $50K (50% buffer) is added in case ETH price goes down
       * If TokenBuyer already holds ETH, then it will be sent less ETH accordingly
* When the proposal executes:
    1. 100K USDC it sent to Builder A
        * If TokenBuyer has less than 100K USDC on hand, a debt will be registered towards Builder A
    3. TokenBuyer will swap ETH for 100K USDC
    4. Any remaining USDC debt to Builder A is paid as soon as it is swapped

### UI preview

This is a preview of a new proposal creation flow for nouns.wtf developed by Brian.
It will go live once it's possible to request USDC.

![proposal_ui_1](https://i.imgur.com/cOqFO3V.png)
![proposal_ui_2](https://i.imgur.com/vZNqCJ7.png)

### Parameters

* `baselinePaymentTokenAmount`: amount of USDC to hold "on hand". Currently set to $500,000.
* `botDiscountBPs`: a price discount to incentivize anyone (probably bots) to swap USDC for ETH. Currently set to 10 bps (0.1%).

### Admin access
* The tech pod & the DAO have an "operator" privilege with permissions to:
    * Modify `baselinePaymentTokenAmount`, allowed range is: 0 - $1M
    * Modify `botDiscountBPs`, allowed range is: 0-150 (0-1.5%)
    * Pause TokenBuyer swaps
    * Withdraw ETH from TokenBuyer and send it to the DAO
    * Change the operator
* Only the DAO has the ability to:
    * Send USDC
    * Change the allowed ranges for `baselinePaymentTokenAmount` and `botDiscountBPs`

### Arbitrage bot
* A reference bot has been developed and [open-sourced](https://github.com/solimander/eth-buyer-arbitrage-bot) by solimander. We encourage anyone to run their own bot or improve on the code
* The tech pod will be running the reference bot at the beginning to bootstrap the system
* Anyone can perform swaps against TokenBuyer. If we see low activity, we will increase the `botDiscountBPs` parameters to increase the incentive (e.g. if gas prices become high).

## Auditing and Testing

* The smart contracts were audited by yAcademy. [Audit report](https://github.com/nounsDAO/token-buyer/blob/166ec30ecd5dada8e17b55317ce3823d4c36b35f/audit/yAcademy_NounsDAO_TokenBuyer_review.pdf)
    * No "critical" issues were found
    * 1 "high" and 1 "medium" issues were found. The "high" issue was fixed, and the "medium" issue was acknowledged as not being an issue for us.
* Prior to this proposal a few rounds of funding and spending using Token Buyer were done on mainnet


## Funding
* Assuming `baselinePaymentTokenAmount` is set to $500K, we would want to fund TokenBuyer with enough ETH to swap for $500K. We suggested adding an extra 50% to account for price changes. At current ETH prices this 750,000 / 1200 = 625 ETH
* The initial ETH amount will be sent to the tech pod multisig
* The tech pod will deploy it into TokenBuyer in chunks while monitoring that it performs correctly

---

Included Transactions:

* Send 625 ETH to: `0x79095391743e0f017A16c388De6a6a3f175a5cD5` (Tech Pod Multisig)

title: Sail Nouns in the New York Harbor for NFT.NYC 2023
description:
# Sail Nouns in the New York Harbor for NFT.NYC 2023

![](https://i.imgur.com/PHkFAtJ.jpg)

### TL;DR
 - Fleet of seven J/24 sailboats with Nounish sails and one bigger sailboat
 - Photo and video opportunities in front of Manhattan, Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty
 - 100 guests onboard will actively participate by steering boats and trimming sails 
 - Post-event meetup at the Manhattan Yacht Club’s clubhouse

# Description

### Why Sailing?
I ([fiveoceans_dev](https://twitter.com/fiveoceans_dev)) have been sailing for 11 years and recently combined my passion for sailing and love of Nouns by organizing a regatta through Seoul (funded by [Prop 102](https://nouns.wtf/vote/102)). Sailing is one of the most prestigious sports and often gets attention of the media, guests, and residents. It's enjoyable to participate in, to watch live, and creates beautiful images and video to share.


### Nouns in the New York Harbor
NFT.NYC is only four months away. Most likely NFT and web3 projects are going to run the same promotions with posters and billboards. *Why not make something different?*

Following the success of [Prop 102](https://nouns.wtf/vote/102), I would like to organize a sailing event on April 9th in New York with help of Manhattan Yacht Club. The NFT.NYC sailing event is going to be order of magnitute larger to match the gravity of the legendary New York.


I will put together a fleet of seven J/24 sailboats and one bigger sailboat in New York bay with Nounish sails. We are going to invite Nounish people and sail together from New Jersey to Manhattan, Brooklyn Bridge, and the Statue of Liberty.

We'll be using J/24 sailboats for this event because it is the world's most popular one-design keelboat. It is a classic Porsche of sailing and respected by all sailors. It is easy to sail and looks beautiful when you get up the Nounish spinnakers.


### Interactive Community Building
The plan is to make teams of 3 experienced sailors and 3-4 guests for each boat. The guests will be able to actively participate by steering boats and trimming sails. We are going to use one bigger boat to accomodate all guests and swap guests on boats near the Statue Of Liberty so all the guests can get full experience. 100 people will be invited, with priority to for the Nouns community. 20 invitations will be sent to special NFT.NYC attendees (media, artists, etc.) 

It is going to be unforgettable experience. Later, we can gather together at Manhattan Yacht Club's clubhouse and share a few beers.

Let's enjoy early spring sailing in NYC together and use this unique opportunity as a team building and proliferating event. A lot of New Yorkers and visitors are going to see Nouns logos during NFT.NYC and posted on social networks.

### Documentation
All events/locations before and during the event will be documented and all media will be regularly shared with the [nounish ⌐◨-◨](https://twitter.com/nounish) team and posted on social networks.

----
# Details

### Event map
![](https://i.imgur.com/ysZx8iI.png)

### Nouns branded sail designs
![](https://i.imgur.com/S7SfqsE.jpg)

Based on sail inventory availabe at Manhattan Yacht Club, it would be best to buy both mainsail and spinnaker sails. The available at manhattan yacht club sails have mount gay rum logos and wouldn't look good during our photo ops.

Discussions on sail designs and upcomming events will be posted on twitter and nounish discord.

After NFT.NYC, the sails will be shipped and stored in my yacht club, in korea for possible future Nounish events.

There are four different design options availbe
1) same color fabric, red noggles
2) same color fabric, different color noggles
3) different color fabrick, red noggles
4) different color fabric, different color noggles
![](https://i.imgur.com/Jiz8Rn0.png)

IMO most of the beautiful thing about nouns community is collective hacking, designing, and thinking. I would like to get feedback from community to find best sail designs. 


----
# Budget
### Nouns NFT.NYC sailing photo op & team building
We going to invite as many people as possible, starting with Nounish folks. The event would be a best way to proliferate Nouns and organize a team building event for Nounish people.
- **$24,000** Chartering fees for 7+ boats at Manhattan Yacht Club
    - I received quote of $3,800 per boat for a general public
    - The price might go down after I send an official request from my yacht club
- **$35,000** Nouns sails inventory for 7+ boats
    - (branded spinnakers and mainsails)
    - I wil keep all the sails safe for future possible events. For example, NFT.NYC sailing event in 2024!
- **$10,000** Small travel grants for sailing teams comming from Seattle, San Francisco, Texas, Michigan, Maryland.
    - We need experienced crew to operate sailboats.
    - The plan is to make teams of 3 pro sailors and 3-4 guests per one boat
- **$15,000** Safety and media motor boats etc
    - It is very important to have a couple motor boats available for media or in the case of emergency
- **$5,000** The big boat is going to accomodate more guests. Later, on the way back from the Statue Of Liberty, we aregoing to swap guests and give more people chance to experience J/24 sailing.
    - NFT.NYC is a big event and we might want to invite a lot of interesting people to the Nouns sailing event
    - Also, some parts of New York bay is no fly zone for drones so it would be best to put a few photographers on a bigger boat
- **$15,000** photo/video team
- **$5,000** Nouns branded t-shirts and caps to look like a true team (120 pcs)
- **$5,000** BBQ, beers, and rum for after party at Manhattan Yacht Club
- **$21,000** expenses for operations team including me; $7k per person (I will need at least two reliable people with sailing experience with me to organize 7+ sailboats, photo ops, coordinate everyone etc; getting ready venue and boats 2 days before the event; 2 days cleaning boats and packing everything after the event)
- **$15,000** budget for unexpected expenses and price offset (we can use some money to make invitations, rent more sailboats, buy more sails, stickers for boats, add more safety measures, shipping or storage for sails after the event etc)
- **$10,000** I would like to request a small compensation for my efforts to plan the event for next 3 months.

**Total: $160,000 or ~134 ETH (1 ETH = $1,200)**

We are asking for $160,000. It is a lot of money but it is worth every dollar if you look at everything we are going to accomplish.

----
# Person in Charge
I am [fiveoceans_dev](https://twitter.com/fiveoceans_dev), member of Nouncil, creator of [Prop 102](https://nouns.wtf/vote/102), sailing since 2011, and love Nouns Community.

---- 
# Multisig
The receiving address is a Gnosis Safe with 4/6 signers.

**Multisig address**: 0xAC2671bAaA44b79cA1Fb006750c684E5349d721b

**Multisig signers:**
1. **toady_hawk**: 0x5D802e2Fe48392c104Ce0401C7ECa8a4456f1F16
2. **benbodhi**: 0x80826180A2629206E3499B5167aaC8440E3F87f6
3. **adrianmcli**: 0xE7304bA0f157f2Ade94015934284b6704BC72911
4. **Brennen**: 0xf8a065f287d91d77cd626af38ffa220d9b552a2b
5. **142**: 0xE6232ed3436C4065D38D8BFdC8EA90858ecDfa69
6. **fiveoceans_dev**: 0xDf6e59c6DF1E9500fd35A76FF4C62F9901E90019

$160,000 USD = ~134 ETH (1 ETH = $1,200 USD)
Adding 15% buffer for volatility: 154 ETH

**Proposed Transaction**
```
0xAC2671bAaA44b79cA1Fb006750c684E5349d721b.transfer(
 154.0 ETH
)
```

### Swap Plan
Upon receipt of funds, signers will convert the ETH to $160,000 USDC.
- Leftover ETH will be sent back to Nouns DAO treasury
- $60,000 USDC will be sent to fiveoceans_dev's wallet upon conversion
    - the money will be used to book sailboats, and pre-order sails 
- $100,000 USDC will be kept in the safe until all the details of the Nouns NFT.NYC sailing event are finalized and posted (date, event program, sail designs, invitations)

title: Proposal tracking by maty
description:
# Proposal tracking by maty

**TLDR**: Fund maty to continue tracking all funded [proposals](http://www.proposal.wtf) (46 ETH saved) and writing [newsletters](https://nouns.substack.com/) (over 16k views) for 5.5 ETH/month.

## About me
Active in nouns every day for a year, founding Nouncil and Esports Pod member, Discord mod (rip), NSFW team member... but most of my work has been centered around a weekly newsletter and proposal tracking dashboards I have created in Notion.

## Tracking proposals
**Problem:**  It's hard to follow individual projects after they get funded, the information is scattered. Accountability is important.

**Solution:** 
- I'm following up with builders of all funded projects, providing a way for builders to share all the awesome work they've done
- Saving the data to Notion [proposal.wtf](http://www.proposal.wtf) - 5 interconnected dashboards with all the important info, allows anyone to quickly and easily search for any project, filter and sort them based on various properties or see all projects by a particular builder.

Thanks to these follow-ups, I have contributed to **46 ETH being returned to the DAO** (from 2 proposals with leftover funds).

**Future focus:** 
- Getting cleaner-looking dashboards up on nouns.center (in collaboration with cdt, you can already find the Communities list we made [here](https://nouns.center/groups))
- Working with the Agora team to display relevant information in Agora profiles


![](https://i.imgur.com/1sdJQWz.gif)




## Newsletter 
**Problem:** Information overload, hundreds of funded projects + even more seeking funding. With the dissolution of the official Discord server, this only got worse.
**Solution:** 
- Weekly [newsletter](https://nouns.substack.com/) highlighting the biggest things happening around nouns, showcasing new proposed projects, new on-chain proposals, art, and more. Serves as an information distribution mechanism and as a historical snapshot of the DAO. [*Example*](https://nouns.substack.com/p/raising-from-the-ashes).
- Special posts for Prop House rounds with TLDRs of all proposals (and other functions when needed) everything in one place, easy to read. [*Example*.](https://nouns.substack.com/p/prop-house-special-nouns-launchpad-9da)
    - this helps us more effectively deploy capital via Prop House
- Newsletter data:
    - over 50 posts already (6 a month on average), with **over 16,000 reads** in total!
    - latest posts get around 350-400 readers
    - subscriber count is in a steady uptrend from the start, currently at 430

**Future focus:**
- highlighting the newly emerging communities
- special posts with big proposal updates (highlights of changes from the dashboards)

![](https://i.imgur.com/c54uvvl.gif)


## Funding
Previously my work has been funded via NSFW (monthly, based on the amount of work, 4.5-5.5 ETH), but since now I am an active member of NSFW, I am seeking funding via on-chain proposal.
I am asking for **5.5 ETH a month** for 7 months:
- 1 month retro for October (7 newsletter posts, maintaining the dashboard and adding a new one - Communities/Groups)
- 6 months going forward, paid via Sablier stream (until the end of April)
- A total of 38.5 ETH

title: PropBox: A Nouns Proposal Incubator
description:
# PropBox: A Nouns Proposal Incubator

## TL;DR

Using lessons from a Nouncil trial program, we will set up a robust incubator that will help the best builders in the ecosystem smoothly navigate the Nouns DAO proposal process.  

**Our goal is to leverage the breadth and depth of skillsets within UglyDAO to help nounish builders communicate well and find pathways to funding, so that they can keep doing what they do best:** 

**BUILDING.**

[![andrew-propbox.gif](https://i.postimg.cc/fbwksjjM/andrew-propbox.gif)](https://vimeo.com/774011051/886e16a979)
*Click to watch a 3 minute video summary of this proposal.*

# The Challenges



1. **The Nouns DAO Proposal Process Can be Daunting to New Builders.**
    
    Writing a proposal is difficult. Conveying a good idea in a way that voters can understand and relate to is even more difficult.  With the increased number of proposals and ideas coming in weekly, it’s more important than ever to effectively communicate one's idea and value proposition.  For some builders, proposal writing may not be a core strength. So their proposals may fail on-chain, even if the core concept is valuable.
    
2. **Effective Communication with DAO Voters is Difficult**
    
    One of the most difficult challenges for builders in the Nouns ecosystem has always been figuring out how to have open dialog with voting Nouners and Delegates. These challenges will only increase as the DAO grows. Now, with the Official Nouns Discord closed, this is an even more pressing issue. 
    
3. **Constructive and Honest Feedback is Rare**
    
    Very few people within Nouns are giving truly honest and constructive criticism to proposals that need work. Discourse and Nouncil feedback sometimes can be “soft”, as people may not want to publicly discuss the potential pitfalls of a fellow community member’s idea or hurt their feelings.  We see this occurring more frequently with on-chain proposals, and it doesn’t help anyone in the long run.



[![boxbrain.gif](https://i.postimg.cc/14xN6w0Y/boxbrain.gif)](https://postimg.cc/wRVvYtGh)*Think INSIDE the box!*


# Our Solutions

**PropBox will aim to solve the above pain points in the following ways:**

1. Ugly Dao has a talented roster of builders, many of whom have experience writing successful proposals for Prop House, NSFW and on-chain. We also have professionals with experience in the legal, marketing, education, and communications fields. With our combined training and experience, we can help builders create proposals that make an impact. Additionally, sometimes the most difficult part of seeking funding from Nouns is **knowing where to go.** We can help proposers understand if their idea is best suited to a Prop House round, an NSFW pitch, a discussion with the newly minted DCS Pod, or a full on-chain proposal. Finally, we believe that proposals should lean on multimedia content to achieve maximum impact in an attention-scarce environment. We want to help builders integrate engaging videos and visuals into their proposals.

2. We know the Nouns community like the back of our Ugly hand, and can help new builders navigate the difficult task of amplifying the message of their proposal. From appearances on The Noun Square, discussions in Nouncil or other Nounish discords, as well as conversations on Twitter, Discourse, House of Nouns and elsewhere, we know how to help builders with the most difficult part of getting funded for a proposal: **Communicating directly with the people who ultimately will vote yes or no.** 

3. The DAO needs more well-intentioned people who are not afraid to give would-be builders The Ugly Truth, and we are prepared to do so.


# The PropBox Value Prop

Our goal is to become the premier resource to help builders create great proposals and find pathways to funding in the Nouns ecosystem. We plan to find and incubate teams and projects from multiple sources, including:

- Current builders in the ecosystem who are looking for feedback and help navigating the proposal process.
- New builders who need extra help onboarding into Nouns, writing proposals, and making the right connections to be successful.
- “Uncut gems” from Prop House and Discourse to fund proof of concept projects and prepare the teams for potential larger on-chain proposals in the future. We aim to find builders with the highest potential and help them fulfill that potential. Ideas from this category should have at least 10x potential from the amount of initial funding.

# The Origin Story

This project began as an initiative by [Andrew ](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/andrewladdusaw.eth)[Laddusaw](https://twitter.com/AndrewLaddusaw), through [Nouncil](https://discord.gg/nouncil), following the [Combinator Round in Prop House](https://prop.house/nouns/open-round:-25-eth) back in July (aka “the before times.”) Andrew saw a lot of talented teams that submitted great proposals, but of course the round only had one winner for the 25ETH prize. 

He began contacting builders and building a system within Nouncil Discord to give these teams feedback to prepare them for an on-chain proposal, or to help them secure alternative funding sources. When they began reviewing proposals publicly as a group, other builders asked for help as well.

During this initial trial, the Incubator team gave feedback to 9 proposals. Through that process: One secured funding through NSFW. One pursued another Prop House to fund a proof of concept, won, and later joined Nouncil. One ended up abandoning the initial idea, but moved on to other projects during the incubation process, and has now been funded for multiple other projects within the DAO (shout out [ripe0x](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/ripe0x.eth).) Two other proposals ended up with on-chain votes, one narrowly being defeated and one securing funding for 40 ETH (Prop 144 for One Click Bots). 

[![andre-testimonial.gif](https://i.postimg.cc/JnndSt6P/andre-testimonial.gif)](https://vimeo.com/774010662/b852cb4533)
*Click to watch a 2 minute PropBox testimonial video from Andrei (BotFrens)*

We learned a lot through this experiment. We’re continuing to follow up with the builders as they hone their ideas, and expect to see even more fruit from these efforts in the coming months. We’re also continuing to improve our feedback process and we believe we’re ready for the next phase of growth.


# The Timeline

**This proposal will support the PropBox team for a 3 month period to do the following:**

- Actively locate builders in the ecosystem to help drive their ideas forward and guide them through the proposal process that is most appropriate to their ideas and building stage.
- Create an active Builder’s Guild in the PropBox Discord, where those who are creating tools and proposals can do so in the open, and together. This well help create consistent startup energy in the Nouns community.
- Review every Discourse, and various Discord community posts, making sure everyone submitting proposal ideas gets quality feedback and the best possible Nouns experience when they first arrive in the community. One of our greatest desires is that new, talented builders would not leave the community discouraged after getting negative feedback, simply because they didn’t understand the funding process or the culture of what it means to be a part of Nouns.
- Create a website to house a toolkit of templates, best practices, tips and tricks, and contact information giving builders a toolbox to maximize success.
- We will also spend the next three months exploring several ideas, which we will present to the community at the end of the proposal funding period:
    - *How to potentially make an incubator like this self-sustaining in the future.*
    - *A system to temperature check proposals and gather feedback from as many sources as possible, including from those with the most likelihood to swing vote outcomes.*
    - *How to create efficiencies in the proposal process, so that new community members can transition from their first interactions to building as effectively as possible within the DAO.*
    - *Exploring systems of trust-building to make sure that scammers are not able to abuse the treasury through gaming or fraud.*
    - *Decisions about what form this group should take in the future; how to incorporate new members, ideas, and processes to maintain the highest degree of quality feedback, help, and value to the DAO.*


All of the above is to serve the ultimate goals of PropBox: 

**To help builders write high quality proposals, and to make decision-making simpler and less time-consuming for DAO members.**

# The Budget

**75ETH** **Total**

- **60 ETH** - In our trial, we were able to achieve a great deal of success with people who were just volunteering their time. We know that with DAO funding, we will have much more capacity to onboard talented builders and incubate many more proposals. 
    - **20 ETH** per month as a payment to team members, to be paid retroactively based on work completed and builders helped. This work will include engaging builders at every stage of the proposal process, guiding them, and helping to write effective and media-rich proposals. These team rewards will be distributed via biweekly Coordinape rounds (Nouncil model.) All payment data will be publicly available to the DAO. 
    - Our team goal will be to engage with a minimum of 30 builders about their proposals over the course of a 3 month period. 
    
- **10 ETH** for a pool to fund some small projects, as an experiment in additional targeted flexible funding for the DAO: Taking small ideas that we encounter through the process of our work and helping those teams to execute small ideas or create MVPs of larger ones. 
- **5 ETH** of retro funding for what has been done to build this system already.

# The PropBox Team

We are a group of Nounish builders that have created and executed successful proposals at every funding level. We are consistently active in Discourse, offering constructive feedback and working privately with builders to help them formulate effective proposals and seek funding. We are passionate about great ideas, effective communication, and robust proposals that drive the nounish meme forward. ⌐◨-◨

[![propbox-group-shot-smaller.png](https://i.postimg.cc/qvQ8CwwZ/propbox-group-shot-smaller.png)](https://postimg.cc/ZWB9Gr1r)

- ***Lead: [Andrew Laddusaw](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/andrewladdusaw.eth)***
- ***Core Team:***
***[BradQ](https://twitter.com/iambradq)***
***[ProfWerder](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/profwerder.%E2%8C%90%E2%97%A8-%E2%97%A8)***
***[SuperTightWoody](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/supertight.eth)***
***[Toady Hawk](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/toadyhawk.%E2%8C%90%E2%97%A8-%E2%97%A8)***

***Support: Other UglyDAO Members***
*18 super builders and counting with diverse skills and talents who are passionate ambassadors for Nouns inside and outside of the community*

**Multisig:**
*Funds will be transferred to and held in a 3/5 Gnosis Safe (propboxvault.eth) with the 5 trusted Nouns community members above.*

# The Bottom Line

We believe the DAO needs to attract more awesome builders, and needs teams of diligent people finding good ideas and helping them to bloom into full-fledged, effective Nounish initatives. 

We are uniquely qualified to help these builders write awesome proposals, strategize ideal funding paths, and facilitate DAO communications, and we are asking for a mandate to do exactly that. 

## Think INSIDE the Box, vote YES for Prop 175!

title: Nouns Archive Expansion
description:
# Nouns Archive Expansion

![](https://i.imgur.com/7ldC7Dl.jpg)

---
### **TL;DR**
* [Nouns Archive](https://nounsarchive.wtf/) is an one-stop archive center which contain the creativity of NounsDAO's contestants and all the memes proliferations.
* We intend to continue to grow by integrating projects from all over the Nouns community and by introducing a streamlined landing page with upgraded visuals.
* 4 months of operation.
* 38.18 ETH requested.
* Nouns Archive Expansion Mockup - [TRY ME NOW!](https://xd.adobe.com/view/0e080238-8b33-4a6b-9135-db84ea8a9963-5b5b/?fullscreen&hints=off)

---

### **Introduction**

Hello **NounsDAO**,

I'm **Voadz**, one of the Nouncillors. Periodically, I've seen a tonne of contests hosted by our nounish communities such as [coloring book contests](https://nounsarchive.wtf/portfolio/nounsense-02) by Noun22 & Messhup, [memes contests](https://nounsarchive.wtf/portfolio/noadz-valentines-day) by Noadz, and is now mainly being held by the [Noun Square](https://twitter.com/thenounsquare) team. We have seen full of delightful contest submissions with all sorts of genres from all across the world.

I took an initiative to build a website where we can display all of the entries from NounsDAO's contestants because I personally feel it is very important for the DAO to do so. Additionally, it provides access to all future possibilities. 

As time passes, I feel it needs to grow even more by including all of the Nouns projects from the community and not only the contestants. Our memes proliferations are all contained inside.

Why is it important to document and archive these things?

> "The body continuously explores time and space. It holds our history, if we listen closely." -Chloe Chotrani

![](https://i.imgur.com/aDIU2rB.jpg)

---

### **Summary**

* **Long-term Vision** ; 
    * To retain past and future historical key data of all talented builders & artists that contribute around Nouns ecosystem.

* **Objective** ; 
    * 1) To help **onboard newcomers** that are interested in Nouns so they can catch a **glimpse** of what the project is all about. Navigation will be improved through enhanced visual design to create a stronger first impression.
    * 2) **References that act as inspiration**. Drawing from references is beneficial because it provides our imaginations with tangible things to model after.
    * 3) To create potential opportunity for artists / builders to receive **commissions or collaborative works/projects** with others.

* **Strategy** ; 
    * 1) **Simplified TL;DR / streamlined landing page with upgraded visuals** consists of ; *to browse relevant areas & specific parameters* ;
            * simplified projects/contests brief
            * project owner/hosts
            * total funded/prizes
            * categories (*ex; art, community, tech, marketing, physical etc*)
            * links to discourse/full props/related infos/contests
            * social media (*ex; twitter, discord*)
            * tags / filters *(most recent, oldest, alphabetically)*
            * distinct project images with descriptions
            * status
            * contest winners
            * CC0 label together with proof of CC0 (*ex; toggle/submit forms etc*)
            * search bar with data points
            *( all are shown under **Details**)*

    * 2) **Coordinate with other existing platforms** already in place (ex. ***[nouns.center](https://nouns.center/), [proposal.wtf](https://maty-eth.notion.site/maty-eth/NounsDAO-Proposals-Overview-b8c76e6ac8e44515966ee032ea20f860), [nounish](https://twitter.com/nounish)***) by pooling resources & efforts for maximum efficiency and also to complement each other.
    * 3) **Contents sustainability** ; we will be using Notion for the database and will be publically viewable. Content submission form with formats will be available for community use. An additional idea is to work with Nouns AI team for data scraping by using certain hashtags/keywords *(to be discuss)*.
    * 4) **CC0 Contents & Icon** ; any artist can **enable or declare** their work to be CC0 by submitting forms that will be made available soon. It is freely usable by anyone for remixing and other creative purposes. A "CC0" icon will appear that contains additional proof of CC0.
    * 5) A **daily dose of nounish things** ; daily curated posting of one random nounish project to give more **visibility & brand consistency** for long term goals.
    * 6) Main whiteboard to organise works ; [Nouns Archive's FigJam](https://www.figma.com/file/g1etPE6nK6WtwK35i9C8gs/Nouns-Archive?node-id=0%3A1).

![](https://i.imgur.com/YtMFFYJ.jpg)

* **Measuring Success** ; 
    * 1) We are tracking using Google Analytics and will factor in a monthly report & insights of the website.
    * 2) As per *image* attached, it is an event count for 2 months. 
    * 3) Organic views and engagements will always be the baseline metrics, but currently, **85%** of the contents are exclusively focus on contest entries. We anticipate that the graph will eventually be higher once we have completed building an MVP jointly across all nounish projects.
![](https://i.imgur.com/C8Iu47E.png)


* **Deliverables** ; 
    * 1) Empower existing website, [nounsarchive.wtf](https://nounsarchive.wtf/) as per whole new concept interface attached above.
    * 2) **On-the-go** website with comprehensive materials, including numerous projects and submissions.
    * 3) As per said under ***Strategy***.
    * 4) Biweekly reports and updates on new developments on discourse & social media (*twitter & discord*). Planning to search for other new platform that is suitable to use.

* **What we have delivered** ; 
    * 1) [Nouns Archive Center Website](https://nounsarchive.wtf/) - Funded by [NSFW Team](https://discourse.nouns.wtf/t/nsfw-nouns-archive-center/2413)
            * total artworks uploaded ; **1xxx artworks**
            * total artist contributed ; **2xx artists**
            * all datas are based on Notion.
    * 2) Whole new concept interface for [Nouns Archive Expansion in XD format](https://xd.adobe.com/view/0e080238-8b33-4a6b-9135-db84ea8a9963-5b5b/?fullscreen&hints=off) for testing.

---

### **Details**

![](https://i.imgur.com/x6i81pe.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/eQqnByu.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/dA2iJFW.jpg)

![](https://i.imgur.com/huA5DvG.jpg)

![](https://i.imgur.com/bIOM3V5.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/pLOUw0L.jpg)

![](https://i.imgur.com/2GmWOIG.jpg)

![](https://i.imgur.com/tMBYNAk.jpg)

---

### **Team**

* [**Voadz**](https://twitter.com/thevoadz)
    * Full-time building on Nouns (*Oct 21-Now*)
    * Nouncillor
    * UI / UX + 3D
    * Building [Noun O'Blocks](https://twitter.com/NounOBlocks)
    * Active members of [NounsMY](https://twitter.com/NounsMY)
* [**Nero One**](https://twitter.com/0xNeroOne)
    * Exploring [3D, VJ, Mograph, XR, Creative Coding, NFT, DAO](https://nero1.link/)
    * Building [DinoNouns ( Interactive On-Chain NFT)](https://discourse.nouns.wtf/t/nsfw-dinonouns-interactive-on-chain-nft/2642)

---

### **Period of Engagement**

* 4 months : 15 December 2022 > 15 April 2023

---

### **Budget Breakdown**

For 4 months deliverables & operation ;

![](https://i.imgur.com/upRP1DX.png)

You will notice an increase in the amount asked *(NSFW)*, mainly due to building it *full-time* & the increased *workloads (including extra working hours)*. You can refer under ***Strategy & Deliverables***.

*Rate ; 1 ETH = $1,100 USD,*
**Total ETH amount requested from NounsDAO: 38.18 ETH ( Total USDC: $42,000 )**

* **25.45 ETH** - Voadz
* **12.73 ETH** - Nero One

All funds will be held in a multi-sig wallet that will initiate the following transactions:

* Convert ETH to $42,000 USDC ($210 for txn fees)
* Paid via 0xSplits stream (until the end of April)

This budget will be governed by Voadz & Nero One and controlled by a 2/2 multi-sig.
*0xdd7e4d8A5FEF6702F7e9C5B45dB440ba7a6e00c0*

---

### **Notes**

![](https://i.imgur.com/FJgalEQ.png)

Our small grants contract will no longer be in effect by the **end of November 22**. We are committed to continue working on this, we intend to use the remaining time efficiently to solicit input and suggestions & finding sponsors while concurrently making changes to this prop and submit for on-chain.

Thanks.
Voadz ⌐◨-◨

title: Nouns funding ZachXBT
description:
# Nouns funding ZachXBT

[@ZachXBT](https://twitter.com/zachxbt) is a public good serving the crypto ecosystem through tireless research exposing [countless scams](https://investigations.notion.site/). Recent events have highlighted the dire need and importance of such work. This prop proposes to fund 100 ETH to their donation address: zachxbt.eth (address can be verified from their twitter profile).

Donations have always been somewhat controversial within Nouns governance. [Prop 21](https://nouns.wtf/vote/21) donating 169 ETH to Gitcoin grants was one of the most contentious votes in our early history. [Prop 108](https://nouns.wtf/vote/108) donating 500 ETH to Ethereum protocol development (via the Protocol Guild) was much more unanimous but still there was discomfort and discourse around whether the DAO was becoming "a tax inefficient way for DAO members to make donations." 

I agree that we shouldn't resort to becoming a complacent vehicle of passive philanthropy. We should instead aim to actively contribute and be a net producer of public goods ourselves such that our meme (brand) can fully capture the provenance value (claim on originality of) the public work and thus leverage the virtuous cycle to do more than what capital alone could have done. However, there should be exceptions to this rule if there is an urgent and common public cause that warrants highlighting. I would like to suggest that this is such a case. Crypto needs more validators like ZachXBT.

With donations we need to be extra wary of conflicts of interest or self-dealing. Unfortunately there is no way to prove this cryptographically, but I attest that I have no prior (or planned future) relationship with ZachXBT and that today was the first time I contacted them (via twitter) to ask for their permission to make this proposal.

title: Explorer Grants - Trial
description:
# Explorer Grants - Trial

![image](https://aws1.discourse-cdn.com/standard21/uploads/nouns/optimized/2X/b/be6270ef4049c16180cde5177b5c21ac878d1b7b_2_690x431.png)

# Explorer Grants - Trial

**Core Issue:** A lot of talented builders have Nouns on their radar, but are not sure how to contribute. The only place we actively incentivize them with ideas and funding is Prop House mandated rounds, which are retroactive, leaving builders who lose the round uncompensated for their work. Otherwise, they must figure out problems themselves and then ask for money, a difficult process if someone has no connections to the ecosystem.

**Solution:** Create a program to actively recruit new talented builders and pro-actively fund them to explore the Nouns ecosystem.

### TL;DR
* 1 grant = 10 ETH for 2 months of exploration, goal for each builder is to have an on-chain prop by end of the period
* 5 builders (50 ETH total) in first trial run
* 3 members on operations team (mrtn, jihad, dot), lightly compensated; 2 more on multi-sig (yitong and krel)
* Transparency is key

### Eligibility
- Must NOT be actively or recently funded by Nouns, or clearly an existing participant in the Nouns ecosystem
- Must be new to the broader Nouns ecosystem
- Must be working / actively exploring _something_ directly related to NounsDAO while on grant, or it will be revoked
- Preference for people who can proactively create independently — particularly engineers, but also content creators, designers, writers, etc

### Operation Details
The entire process will be transparent via a public Discord and run by the 3-person team, who will be lightly compensated to do this work, ensuring accountability and commitment. Our initial proposal had no funding for the team, but we were recommended otherwise by Nouners.

**Public Application:**
* Explorer Grants will be publicized via Twitter, 1:1 outreach from the team and its network, Twitter Spaces with Nouns community organizations, Discords, etc
* Candidates will submit public applications, showing past work and motivations for exploring the Nouns ecosystem, as well as a couple problem spaces that interest them
  * These applications will also benefit the community at large who can recruit builders from this group
* Candidates will largely be assessed on talent, potential, and excitement about Nouns. Reasoning for accepted candidates will be made public. The 3-person team will decide on 4 final candidates to accept.
* 1 slot in the program will be allocated to a Nouns community vote

**Program:**
* 10 ETH for 2 months of part-time exploration for each builder
  * *Detail: Overpaying slightly is critical to attracting talent that may not otherwise come to us. We are targeting people who make more than $150,000 a year in their full-time job*
* Weekly check-in call with builders. Members of the Explorer Grants team will help them explore ideas, connect them to Nouners and builders, and lead workshops
* **End of Program Objective:** each builder submits an on-chain or Prop House prop for continued funding

### Team
* **mrtn, lead organizer:**
    * Previously a PM at Google and NBA Top Shot, he has now contributed to a variety of Nounish projects - Nouns Builder, AI Pod, Agora, as well as doing a 24 Hour Nounish live stream, and receiving a Governance Historian grant. At USC, he ran an organization that guided students towards entrepreneurship, whose members include several YC startups. He's a big believer in diversifying funding sources for Nouns builders, and experimenting with the patronage model. *Comp: 3 ETH / month*
* **jihad, community & product expert:**
    * Core contributor at Forefront, creating media and building infrastructure for tokenized communities. He is also a delegate and “Lil Nouncilor” at Lil Nouns DAO, a contributor to Public Nouns, one of the winners of the recent Nouns Agora delegate race, and is part of the team building [Adjectives](nouns.terminal.co), an analytics and proposal evaluation platform for Nouns DAO. Jihad believes that Nouns must be a center of excellence for tokenized communities, and the Explorer Grants program would be a step in the right direction in attracting the brightest minds to do focused yet unstructured work in the Nouns ecosystem. *Comp 2 ETH / month*
* **dot, technical expert:**
    * Dot is an iOS dev turned nounish builder - a founding member of Nouncil and most recently Lil Nounder at Lil Nouns DAO; the first full fork of Nouns DAO. Dot started Lil Nouns as a way to expose nouns to as many people as possible. Lil Nouns DAO leverages its 8 nouns alongside its own treasury to fund and support public goods built by lil nouners. In doing so, Lil Nouns has become a builder onramp to Nouns DAO itself. *Comp: 2 ETH / month*

***We will use a 3 of 5 multi-sig, with the core team members as well as krel and yitong.***

### Questions
**How will you actually find these builders?** Our team has fairly deep networks within the crypto and broader tech space; we'll leverage our personal connections as well as our social media presence to find more builders. Additionally, a large appeal of programs like these (Thiel Fellowship, Prop House, MacArthur Grants) is the benefit of continued funding + prestige, which we intend to lean into.

**But what if the builders don't do anything?** This is similar to everything in Nouns already - there's a social contract to uphold, someone could always dissapear after receiving 200 ETH on-chain. We can setup the grant via Sablier to revoke if a builder goes MIA, however.

**What will they actually build?** The first round will not have a particular mandate but future ones could be structured closer to Prop House mandated rounds, where there is a theme. We believe that time and freedom is key to allowing talented builders to find something meaningful to build long-term.

**Why not just run this on Prop House?** Decisions are not always best made by large committees. Prop House rounds do not allow for deep conversation and analysis of candidates. A transparent, small committee allows for depth and betting on candidates who might not otherwise get a shot (i.e. people who aren't good at writing a description on prop house but would be amazing builders). Additionally, we'd like to create a long-term relationship with these builders via an organized cohort.

**What if no good work comes out of this?** That's a possibility, as is the case with prop house rounds. However, we believe that Nouns already has a great enough brand to attract solid builders. However, if nothing goods comes out of this trial, then we will have learned that pro-active grants for attracting builders is not a valid technique for our DAO. If there are takeaways, they can be adapted into other funding sources, like Prop House or NSFW in the future.

**Why are you being paid?** Our initial proposal did not include payment for the team, but it was suggested by Nouners that we should be getting paid to create accountability, as well as allow us to dedicate more time in making this more of a full-fledged program than one-off grants with no support from us.

### Total Funding
5 Builders x 10 ETH = 50 ETH
Team Comp: 14 ETH
Total: 64 ETH

***Questions? Contact mrtn on Discord (mrtn#7388) or Twitter ([@anquetil](https://twitter.com/anquetil))***

title: Worst Case Decision x Nouns - Episodic Video NFTs
description:
# Worst Case Decision x Nouns - Episodic Video NFTs

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Bygv3XEIj.gif)

     
Hey Nouns DAO,

Artist and slapstick conceptualist [Marc Horowitz](http://1833marcive.com/) here, with a proposal to co-create a Nouns DAO-ified season of my new serialized NFT video collection, Worst Case Decision. It’s like Adult Swim on a dozen espresso shots, in one-minute-or-less episodes, released as 1/1 NFTs.

This is an opportunity to expand Nouns DAO culture by unleashing highly visible artist-created, community-developed CC0 video content that can be distributed everywhere. It’s also a brand-new way to use web3 tooling to release episodic videos, and an opportunity to pioneer a decentralized media production model that can help inform the future of entertainment. 
**takes a breath*

Read on and watch the below video to learn more.

[![Worst Case Decision](https://cdn.hashku.com/wcd/Nouns_WCD_Pitch_vid_screenshot_1500x.jpg)
](https://vimeo.com/772223496/a53f2e2dad "Worst Case Decision")


## What’s Worst Case Decision?
Worst Case Decision is maybe the first episodic “show” to be released as an NFT series.

Each season of WCD features 7 bite-sized fever dreams that are handcrafted into 30-70 second “episodes.” Every episode chases surreal characters along a bat-shit hyper-casual narrative that loosely follows a theme. So far we’ve explored themes such as “mayonnaise portal,” “everyone is wet,” “hi-fi asparagus rain,” and “too many cats,” to name a few.

The show’s vibe feels like surfing in a sea of technicolor absurdity, with a low-fi, internet-infused, stop-motion animation style. Video, painting, web3, DALL-E, comedy, commerce… WCD has it all. (Scroll to the bottom of this proposal to view sample episodes.)

**Worst Case Decision Quick Facts:**

* 50 Seasons planned, 7 episodes per season (350 episodes total)
* Episodes released episodically as 1/1 video NFTs via worstcasedecision.com
* Each season features an ever-changing cast of characters and collaborators
* NFTs can be purchased with credit card and digital currency (ETH)

## What makes this exciting for Nouns DAO?
We’re at the dawn of a new era for entertainment—one that will enable audiences and creators to build sustainable models of cultural production together. As perhaps the first-ever serialized 1/1 NFT video collection, Worst Case Decision is taking a pioneering approach to launching meme-y, weird, funny narrative shorts with and for the communities who believe this kind of art should exist in the world. 

Beyond pioneering this new web3-native episodic production model, there are a few specific benefits that Nouners can expect from supporting this project:

**Noun-ified Episodes**
The entire season will be built based on decentralized creative direction by opening up key decisions to the Nouners (and in some cases the internet at large, for max visibility). This includes community input/voting on:
* The “themes” of each episode
* Protagonists (I’ve got so many weird character ideas, man)
* Supporting cast (really, so many weird characters)
* Episode backgrounds

**CC0 Content & Nouns Memes**
The Nouns season of WCD will be entirely CC0. This means that anyone can meme the shit out of the entire season, which will be full of Nouns references, noggles, and other inside jokes specific to Nouns’ community, culture, and lore. Cut up and re-mix the episodes however y’all see fit, and post wherever you want.

**Additional Benefits to Nouns DAO**

1)	**Major marketing and PR exposure.** This is a first-of-its-kind video collection in the NFT space, and there’s “a lot of press to be had.”
2)	**WCD is planned for 50 seasons.** Nouns would be the 3rd season of 50, and the first-ever sponsored season—representing an early entry into supporting what could become a historic release.
3)	**Introduce Marc’s audience to Nouns.** I’ve been an independent artist for 25 years, and as a result I’m decently well known. I can help bring the fine art world’s attention to Nouns and web3 at large.
4)	**Reach non-web3-savvy folks, too.** Our tech partner [Hashku](https://hashku.com) has both crypto-native and custodial credit card minting solutions, meaning that non-crypto folks can participate in NFT auctions.

![](https://cdn.hashku.com/wcd/nouns_pfp_collage%20copy_sm.jpg)

These are just mere examples of potential Nouns x WCD characters! Glorious, yes? Please feel free to take ‘em and make ‘em [your PFPs](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Ff52SL1p3PGzdxYtCO7kyA9kpE2N4EAY?usp=share_link). (Shhhh…. there will be plenty more via https://nouns.build/ in the future.) 

## What makes this exciting for Collectors?
I care immensely about my collectors. I want to add value and make the experience as fun and engaging as the episodes themselves. We have an expansive vision and are thrilled to include our collectors along this journey. 

If you are a holder of a WCD episode from any season, you’ll get access to:

* My network via a private discord channel for collectors (a seat on the board so to speak)
* Input on IRL WCD events
* Early access to future WCD collabs and projects  

## Marketing & Community Development
Our philosophy for marketing and PR follows the vision for the project. Simply put: Our weird creative vision and IRL performances are going to cause some really interesting responses, which we’ll engage with using our built-in strengths with social media and PR.

**Marketing Plan**

* **Launch activities** – Our team will produce strategic content and a mix of online and IRL activations to generate as much pre-launch awareness as possible. We have an existing list of interested & interesting media partners to engage here. The web3 PR agency Serotonin is among them.
*  **High-velocity engagement** – A dedicated Project Ambassador will act as a marketing strategist, online social maestro, and Nouns champion, using multi-channel engagement tactics to build momentum. 

* **Partnerships & sponsorships** – I (Marc) have a long history of partnering with brands to co-create projects. We will be bringing on some truly exciting collaborators and sponsors to spread the word even farther.

* **Long-term community growth** – Our desire is to make this project fully self-sustaining. To do this, our goal is to increase the performance of NFT auctions and overall engagement with the series by aggressively growing the WCD community. 

* **Transparent success metrics** – We will track and analyze meaningful engagement metrics to keep the community informed on how we’re doing, and to strengthen our marketing approaches overall.

## Open-Sourcing Our Promo Strategy

We wish to be as transparent as possible with our learnings about marketing and running this project. We’ll create a public document outlining our goals, metrics, successes, and learnings so that our efforts can help future projects and the community at large.

## Project Team

In addition to an amazing lineup of advisors, our core team currently consists of the following:

**Marc Horowitz** // Creator & Visionary 
**Chris Coy** // Partner & Spiritual Advisor 
**Damien Newman** // Creative Consultant & Power Supporter 
**Matt Casanova** // Builder of Technologies
**Hashku** // Minting Platform

## Budget
Anticipated activities and budgets (by phases):

* **Pre-Production** – $9,650
Studio usage, lighting equipment, episode concepting/ production planning for all 7 episodes, props, backgrounds, art department (hand making all the noggles and weird other props).

* **Production** – $16,875 
Director fee, cinematographer/camera operator fee, additional creative direction and shoot crew/collaborators, daily incidentals during shoot (food, grip, etc), and production assistance.

* **Post-Production** – $11,500 
Sound finishing/sfx/sound design, music licensing, editing, smart contract customizations for specific season NFTs, season-specific website costs (video bandwidth and hosting). 

* **Promotion of Nouns + WCD Season (Outreach/Marketing/PR)** – $17,475
Spread the word about the Nouns DAO and its sponsored season of WCD via strategic editorial write ups, podcast appearances, live events, IRL media stunts/performances, and other activations TBD.  See further notes in “Marketing Plan” (above).


**Total Budget** ($55,500) + price contingency: **50 ETH** (converted to USDC immediately) 


## Timeline & Logistics

**Mid-late February, 2023:** Launch the project with unsponsored seasons 1 and 2.

**Mid-January:** Collaborate with the Nouns community. Using voting mechanisms and other means of gathering community input, we will collectively shape WCD season 3.

**Mid-late January:** Once our Nouns season is planned, each episode takes roughly 2 days to film and edit. That brings pre-production, production, and post-production to 3-4 weeks total.

## How NFT Auctions Will Work on worstcasedecision.com
Each season of WCD video episodes will be dropped over the course of a week (dates will be announced via [@marchorowitz](https://twitter.com/marchorowitz)).
* Each day at 9am PST a new episode will drop on worstcasedecision.com
* Each episode will be released as a 1/1 NFT 
* Each NFT’s auction will end at 8:55:59 am PST the following day
* When one auction closes, the next one drops—and this continues for 7 days in a row, Mon–Sun.

## The Future of WCD and Episodic NFTs
We have the team and vision required to evolve WCD into a genre-defining series. Beyond this, we think we’re onto something in regards to how serialized NFTs can be used as a sustainable model to fund the production of some truly weird and great videos—and other creations as well.

If you are interested in learning more and chatting with Marc and the team personally, please reach out and we’ll have a chat ;)

## Thank you, Nouners!
If I get the chance to collaborate with you all, I know we can make something really fun and amazing. If you have any questions, feel free to [dm](https://twitter.com/marchorowitz) me. 

Also, if you happen to be in the Swiss Crypto Valley, I’m in a show [@unpaired__](https://twitter.com/unpaired__) NFT IRL gallery through 12/02/22 w/ [Krista Kim](https://twitter.com/Krista_Kim), [Shavonne Wong](https://twitter.com/shavonnewong_), [Pak](https://twitter.com/muratpak), [Takashi Murakami](https://twitter.com/takashipom), [Pilar Zeta](https://twitter.com/pilar_zeta), [Nancy Baker Cahill](https://twitter.com/nbakercahill), [The Haas Brothers](https://twitter.com/TheHaasBrothers), and [Urs Fischer](https://twitter.com/CHAOSursfischer).

Much love to you all ✌🏼
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Hy7b2ZEUi.jpg)


# Sample Episodes

## Total Despair: Coffee Maker Fantasy (Season 1, Episode 3) 
After God rains down hi-fi asparagus and kills parrot, our crew gets to the bottom of why such a thing would happen.

[![Worst Case Decision](https://cdn.hashku.com/wcd/Total_Despair_1500x.jpg)
](https://vimeo.com/772224084/46fe908695 "Worst Case Decision")


## Sticky Resuscitation: Frog RomCom (Season 2, Episode 1)
Sometimes a bagel just isn't worth it. Or is it the missing piece to a new romance?

[![Worst Case Decision](https://cdn.hashku.com/wcd/Sticky_Resuscitation_1500.jpg)
](https://vimeo.com/772225011/97801037a7 "Worst Case Decision")


## Night Terrors: Saint Bernard Sci-fi (Season 4, Episode 3)
Saint Bernard's friend didn't take his night meds again :0 

[![Worst Case Decision](https://cdn.hashku.com/wcd/Night_Terrors_1500x.jpg)
](https://vimeo.com/772225676/dde584ff43 "Worst Case Decision")


## Dull Existence: Carlos Tragedy (Season 7, Episode 2)
Carlos's friend Hank is always bored. Not today! Avocado makes his debut.

[![Worst Case Decision](https://cdn.hashku.com/wcd/Dull_Existence.jpg)
](https://vimeo.com/772226353/d4440b962d "Worst Case Decision")
